description:
Bonita is my favorite place to eat on Chestnut. I'm obsessed with the La Campesina Ensalada. I've had it both in the restaurant and as take out and it's HUGE! I also love the elote a lot. I've seen friends order everything else on the menu and the portions are always generous and delicious. But I never venture from my salad because...I love it that much. I feel like it's the dressing that makes it extra good.?? I always order more on the side.

The staff is very friendly. The margaritas are also good but if you have too many you'll have quite the hangover. (...speaking from experience.) 

I was worried about Bonita when Tacolicious moved in across the street...but would pick it over tacolicious every time.
author: Taylor G.

description:
All in all a solid experience! Tasty food, killer salsa, and prices that aren't great but aren't TOO bad. 

From the look of the menu and pictures, I was expecting things to be pretty bland and whitewashed, but I figured I'd give it a try, and I'm glad I did. I got the bonita bowl, and it was delicious - and a generous portion. I got pastorcito, and I'm not 100% sure what that was - Google wasn't much help - I'm guessing similar to el pastor? Either way it was muy sabroso.

The salsas were outstanding, too. Their habanero salsa manages to have all of the flavor of habaneros with very little of the heat - it was making my mouth do a double take. A very weird sensation to be sure.

My roommate got the burrito and chips and salsa; the burrito was good but the "salsa" was just pico de gallo (very disappointing given that their actual salsas are so good!)

I don't know if I'd go there very often given that Pancho's is nearby, but I definitely wouldn't mind returning! Their delivery was also very speedy, which was awesome.
author: Chris S.

description:
It was lunchtime and I had a serious taco craving. I happened to be on Chestnut Street at the time. And as Robert Frost once wrote, "Two roads diverged and I was presented with two taquerias (Tacolicious and Bonita Taqueria Y Rotisserie)... and I took the one less traveled by, and that made all the difference." Wel,, I'm pretty sure he said something along those lines. In any case, I had never dined here before and it didn't look like too long of a wait. So my decision was made! 

Bonita has your standard taqueria offerings (burritos, tacos, fajitas, salads, tortillas soup, etc.). I opted for the street tacos made with rotisserie chicken (see posted photo). I must say that I was pleasantly surprised with the flavors and portion size. At many taco stands, "street tacos" means super tiny. But for $7.95 I got three adult size tacos made with corn tortillas and topped with onions, cilantro, and a generous helping of juicy chicken. I certainly didn't walk away hungry. It was a perfectly satisfying meal for under $10. 

Long story short... I could certainly see myself returning here for lunch if I was back in the neighborhood, or if I was looking for a late night bite after bar hopping in the Marina.
author: Kevin B.

description: I had the macho nachos and they were delicious! My husband had the quesadilla and it was good. Very fresh pico and guac. Sat outside and it was very cute.
author: Stacey H.

description:
Wrong orders, bad attitude and over price Mexican food that actually is more like a texmex or wannabe Mexican street food.

They took 45 minutes to order they were tooo busy with online orders.... Suck for 5 of us and rest of the people waiting.
author: Denish G.

description:
Tacos:
Mahi mahi taco - good sized piece of fish but could've used a little more flavor
Vegetarian taco - really good and packed with flavor
Chicken taco - I liked the mahi mahi and vege taco better but the chicken one was alright too 

Elotes - typical and had a good flavor with the perfect amount of coating 

Shrimp bowl - could've done with less sour cream drizzle but it was very flavorful 

Horchata - delish, refreshing, perfect amount of sweetness 

They also have a really cute aisle-way on the side with bright yellow walls accented with pink flower decor. Overall, the portions and prices were very reasonable for SF. Would definitely recommend you check it out!
author: Vicky R.

description:
What a cute little restaurant with a charming colorful indoor and outdoor sitting!! We were in a rush and got the to-go order. 

The beef quesadilla was very tasty with generous amount of filling. The chicken tacos were delicious and perfect for a lighter lunch. Wish the chicken was a bit juicier, seemed a bit over cooked. 

The setting is great for a nice quiet meal and would definitely try them again when in the area.
author: Mehrnaz H.

description:
Un can we talk about the California burrito?
And how there are potatoes inside this vessel of awesomeness?
Yes? Ok then...
I passed this place and realized I was hungry and need to get grub in me before a movie I was seeing down the street. 
After staring at the menu for moment I decided on the California burrito with steak,(I saw sour cream and said yes) and my companion got steak tacos. 
We sat at the bar facing the street ready to show everyone how we got down with food and waited for our food. And delivered it was. 

I took a bite and my mouth was immediately happy! Those dang potatoes. They were freaking tasty. Mixed in with the beans, sour cream, salsa and steak there was no sense of loss for the rice I usually love. I let my companion taste, and they liked it. So much so that I offered them some more but they stayed with their tacos (which were really good btw)... but as I got full, I offered them more. I mean who gets full on two tacos (ok some people do... just not me)? And they took the rest of my burrito. Saying they were waiting for me to finish so they could have at it. 
I washed this all down with a bottle Coca Cola (glass bottle with real folks). 

I was stuffed by the time I rolled out of there. Which was a good thing cause the movie kinda sucked. 
I think about this burrito... and how good it was... alas I live about an hour and some more north so I don't get to come as often as I like, but man that burrito is worth the drive when I get a chance.
author: Em C.

description: Food is good, straightforward counter service. Told them that the draft beer was improperly gassed and difficult to drink. Their response was tepid and no refund or consideration was offered. If you judge a service establishment by their ability to recover from a mid-step, they fall short.
author: Scott N.

description: Great burrito bowl and tortilla soup. We have eaten here several times and am surprised by the mixed reviews. The food is fresh, flavorful, generous portions and fairly priced. The service is friendly.
author: Erin L.

description: Probably the worst experience ordering food I've ever had. I placed a simple order on Eat 24 app. I noticed the order was not being processed so after 20 minutes I called to see what happened and he said he didn't receive the order, then a couple minutes later he said the order was received. Finally after that, the order was being processed on the app, but it was still "being prepared" after 30 minutes. Again, a very simple order. Finally I call back and the person answering is very bad at communication. I ask him the status of my order and he makes many excuses and says something about refunding me but I didn't know what happened and he couldn't explain anything. Finally he says the driver is on the way, and apologizes. The food comes, literally didn't get what I ordered. The food is cold and disgusting. Never going back to this place!!
author: Rachel P.

description: Ok first off little pricey your in the Marina SF so expected. I went with the rotisserie chicken Bombay delicious 2-sides and corn tortillas everything was cooked to my liking"" make sure you bring your bank roll lol dam dam!
author: Sean K.

description: Wow. This place was absolutely amazing. First we got an order of salsa and guacamole with chips which was amazing. The guacamole was definitely one of the best I've ever had. Then I ordered a shrimp taco and a pork taco and both were amazing. My sister being vegetarian ordered two veggie tacos which she said were amazing. Then my dad ordered NorCal burrito with rotisserie chicken which was amazing. This place is amazing. Nice atmosphere and great food. Perfect place to grab something quick to eat. Also with some good shopping places around it!
author: Kate P.

description:
Warning! Terrible food poisoning after eating here on 2/20. Nothing tasted fresh. Will never return!

*in response to the businesses comment below: my partner was sick also and it happened immediately after eating at your restaurant. We tried to reach someone in management to no avail, as a courtesy, and was laughed at by one of your staff on the phone. Rather than argue with my review and defend the food that made us both so physically ill that we considered going to the ER,... a more appropriate and considerate response would be either nothing at all or a simple apology.
author: Ashley C.

description:
The food here is very good and ready quickly.  It's flavorful and consistent, although the last time I went there the salsa seemed more watery than usual.  The portions are good and the side salsas add another dimension to the experience there.  Their prices are higher than average, but the Marina is really expensive.  

The decor is great, with several seating areas, both inside and outside and festive colors around the restaurant.  The multi-color stools are easy enough to find and perhaps fun for some people- possibly if they've been drinking.    

The customer service is basic, with helpful staff, but no rapport-building in their process.  It could be a much more inviting place if they had some cheerfulness as a standard.  Consequentially, I prefer to get something to-go.
author: Ben G.

description:
Came to this area with the goal of going to Tacolicious however it didn't appear to be family oriented so we came here. 

This place didn't blow me away, somewhat disappointed me, and I did not think at all the prices on the menu matched the authenticity and quality of the food. 

I came here with my family of 4. I ordered the tortilla soup, so did my mom, my sister ordered 2 fish tacos with lettuce instead of the tortilla, and my dad ordered the chicken fajitas. For drinks, my dad and i got Jarritos and my mom got horchata and my sister got pineapple water. The horchata was very dense and tasted more like milk than actual horchata. The pineapple juice was good. 

The tortilla soup was alright. The soup was a bit too thick and I would've appreciated it if they would've add more chicken into the actual soup. My sister loved the fish tacos. They actually messed up her order and ended up giving her a separate order of carne asada tacos, and she enjoyed those too. My dad didn't hate the chicken fajitas but he also didn't love it. It was just whatever, he said It was way too many things mixed together in a bowl. He said it felt like eating a heavy ball of food. However, make no mistake, the food wasn't nasty. It was just really heavy. 

I wouldn't recommend this place. Not authentic and overpriced. We only came here as a last resort. Save your money and go somewhere else.

PS: The WiFi password is the phone number on the menu, without the dashes.
author: Jennifer G.

description: Food here is really good. Their meat is very flavorful and high quality. Amazing portions and prices. I have never met an unfriendly person who works there. It's one of my favorite Mexican spots in the Marina!
author: Charley S.

description: Very good place. In my opinion it is better than tacolicous across the street. It is my favorite Mexican food in the marina.
author: Robert S.

description:
Between 3.5-4 stars. Didn't feel like a typical authentic Mexican place but overall it was good for the neighborhood. We came here to eat a late lunch (4:30pm) after walking around Chrissy Fields and were starving. We sat outside at the bar area cause it felt nice and breezy and casual. They have a pretty nice outside seating (tables for two) and also plenty of space inside. You have to order and pay first and the staff brings the food over.

We ordered separately but the food order got messed up. The biggest concern was when the meat eaters ended up with the veg burrito and the vegetarian person was eating the carne asada burrito. That's a huge mistake from their part. We got lucky the veg person wasn't allergic and was chilled out with it after we found out, but this is not cool at all. We brought it to their attention about the mixed up in our order and they did offer to bring new order but at that point we all had 1/3 of the burritos so it didn't make sense. What was eaten was already digesting so we didn't make a big fuss about it but I was pretty shocked.

Between the 5 of us we ordered:

- 2 burrito bowls
- 1 veg classic burrito
- carne asada bonita burrito
- pascarcito grilled pork taco
- baja style fried fish taco

The bowls were huge and they looked like a jungle with way too many things in it so needless to say our friends didn't finish it.

Pork taco was good but the fried fish taco stole the show. 

Bonita carne asada burrito was a good size, tasty but very little pieces of meat inside. It felt really heavy. Two people shared the 2 tacos and the burrito and it felt quite a bit of food and sat heavy on our stomachs later on that I had to skip dinner.

I'd probably try other places around the area if i'm in the neighbourhood again.
author: Heliana M.

description: The most authentic mexican place I found in the Marina. The aqua fresca are the freshest and I need the Chipotle sauce on everything.
author: Christian M.

description:
The short: delicious friscodilla

My friend and I were walking around Chestnut, trying to decide what to eat. We decided on Super Duper, but after standing in line and seeing the lack of available tables, we found Bonita and were glad we gave it a try!

There's so much on the menu that we took quite awhile to decide. She settled on two tacos, while I picked the friscodilla, a unique twist on the classic quesadilla. I usually don't pick quesadiillas because they're so easy to make at home. With the combination of carne asada (other meat options available), guacamole, corn, and peppers, I ended up really liking the friscodilla. Plus, there was enough leftover to have for lunch the next day! My friend also enjoyed her tacos and they were so beautifully presented too.

We saw the seats in the alley and would loved to have sat there had it not been so cold and rainy.

Verdict: Loved the friscodilla, would come back for that and to try other items on the menu
author: Catherine W.

description: This is a great little restaurant on chestnut. Large portions, but not too greasy. I especially recommend their salad with rotisserie chicken -- it's great! Friendly staff, quick service, affordable prices, great to eat in or take out.
author: Nick M.

description: I stumbled across this cute taqueria while in the Marina. I would solely recommend this place only for their IG worthy alleyway on the side of their restaurant. The food is pretty basic compared to the Mexican restaurants we have in the mission but still worth a visit if you want to sit outside and reminisce on your travels to Mexico.
author: Alexa H.

description:
This taqueria made me very sick!   I got the burrito with Carnitas and ate nothing else. Never have gotten sick like this before, so when a restaurant makes me sick.... it deserves a bad review..


UPDATE:
Called to speak to manager about how sick the food made me.
Me: Is your manager in?
Clerk : he's not yet
Me: do you know when he will come in?
Clerk: honestly, I have no idea

Making sense why the food was bad, poor management, poor food quality
author: Jeff G.

description: I walked in because the atmosphere was great loved the music and the little hall way on the side . But I ordered my food not realizing till after all the reviews I read and it was too late . I got a chicken burrito bowl loved the rice and beans the chicken is very cold very weird  tasting did not eat literally .
author: Wendy M.

description: Food, service and atmosphere were great. Will go again when we are in that area. The street tacos and the Bonita bowl were delicious.
author: Jessica F.

description:
I come here for lunch all the time with my coworker, as we work in the Marina. One of my favorite lunch spots because they have quick, friendly service, tasty food, and they give you HUGE portions. The guys at the cashier are always hook you up with extra to-go hot sauces and a smile! 

The rotisserie chicken is always cooked to perfection + moist to flavor ratio. But what I like the best is the amazing salsas/hot sauces that they have on every table to top it all off with. They taste house-made and the perfect amount of spice levels. 

You can't go wrong with the bowls, but I always get the Fajita plate as you get fajitas + 3 tortilla shells + two sides for around $15. 

Overall Bonita Taqueria is a great place to go if you're looking for tasty, local, fast-casual Mexican food. I come at least once a week and never regret the decision.
author: Liz S.

description:
Dinged a point for loud music.

I like Bonita. I've been in a few times and always wind up ordering similarly. The street-sized tacos are good; pork is a better choice than chicken or beef, which is a bit dry. The elote (corn on the cob with seasoning) is a great side -- probably the high light. Pair with a Mexican beer or fruit drink and you are set. Menu is pretty simple, but gives good competition for the more trendy/foodie taco places in the area.

I been here in the mid afternoon a few times. During the week days, it's fine. You can also sit outside if the weather is warm. But, on a recent Saturday visit, the volume of the music was too loud. No need to be over 80 db (measured with a mobile app) for a small neighborhood place and a small number of locals. I deducted one star for the negative atmosphere. Besides the volume, I didn't care much for the latin pop with excessive auto-tune -- but accept that is down to personal preference.
author: Jice E.

description: Absolutely delicious and loved the little alleyway where you can eat with a friend. Fish tacos were yummy and loved the refried black beans. That said, they seem like they are often short staffed so sometimes the line and wait is a bit excessive.
author: J. N.

description: I absolutely love this place.  Ambiance, food, service is top notch!  I will say it again, they make the best super macho nachos with carne Asada.   And when I'm in the area, I can sip a margarita & people watch!!  Even my dog loves to hang out while we have our munchies!
author: Coni B.

description:
Talking about fake mexican food for American people!
My three year old spite the rice !
Lame salsas! The pastorcito meat is bland with no real flavor!
Save yourself some money and go to the Mission for real Mexican food!
Another joint that will go broke soon!
author: Juan D.

description: I love this place!!!!! They always have great food and customer service, with a great choice of beers. If you want some great Mexican food without breaking the bank then you have found the place. Bonita gives great portions of food and always cooked the right way. If your in the marina area come to this place you won't regret it Jessica helped us out and she was amazing.
author: Anthony V.

description:
Not very impressed. The rotisserie chicken wasn't good, got the classic quesadilla and street tacos. The street tacos were really dry and the quesadillas had A LOT OF cheese, not much chicken. 

Honestly all around disappointed in the food.
author: Raychel J.

description: I'm visiting San Francisco from out of town, and was really craving some authentic Californian chips and guac. I walked by this place and it looked great, but after reading the reviews, I was admittedly a little bit skeptical. I am nine weeks pregnant, and the last thing I needed was a case of food poisoning on top of an already super nauseous first trimester of pregnancy.  Someone else wrote in their review that the chips and guac were really good, so I figured I might as well give it a shot. I got two orders - don't judge, I'm eating for 2, remember? - and I have to say that I was thoroughly delighted. The chips tasted fresh and were perfectly crunchy, and the guac was the exact text her that it should be, and was incredibly flavorful! Well I can't comment on their tacos or other offerings, I can honestly say that everything that people were eating looked fantastic, and if their chips and guac are any indication that this place is a solid win.
author: Alicia C.

description: My usual go tos for Mexican are in Mission but since we were roaming around marina pacific heights area, we decided to try the place for lunch. I didn't have much expectations but was pleasantly surprised! Not only was service quick and efficient, food was very tasty and legit. We had the tortilla soup - taaaasty!! The avocado tortilla shredded chicken ratio was good! I almost didn't want to share with hubster but reluctantly did;). The Mahi tacos were fat and juicy! Not breaded and fried but instead healthy and grilled! The carnitas Tacos were excellent as well. It's a small space but we sat by the window and got to people watch a little. Definitely a good spot with good food and good vibes. Would I come back?! Definitely!!!
author: Sylvia L.

description: Saturday night was my second time getting dinner here after realizing it was crowded at Super Duper, losing my order number. Bonita was half empty, I remember. Life is too short to not appreciate delicious Mexican food! I should come here more often: I will the next Saturday night my favorite burger joint on Chestnut is crowded.
author: Julio B.

description:
Great 'accidental discovery" on Chesnut St.!

First, the place: it might look like a Mexican fast-food but beware: it's not. It's a restaurant (plus rotisserie) serving delicious Mexicanish (fusion) food.
You order at the counter and can sit either inside (shared tables), facing the open windows on Chestnut St., or in the alley, right next to the restaurant in a nicely decorated passage between 2 buildings (see my photo of the yellow painted pathway).
The atmosphere and ambiance (Latin music) is lovely and make you feel like you have been travelling thousand miles away from San Francisco.

The drink: the "spicy margarita" is just amazing. Not too strong, not too sweet, optional salt, very spicy...I felt that zest of "WoW" in my mouth while sipping the whole glass(es...since I drank 2 of those delicious beverages). Note that they also offer draft and bottles beers.

The food: I was expecting regular tacos/fajitas but not. The chicken rotisserie taco was heavily loaded with large, tender and juicy chunks of chicken meat, seasoned with delicious sauteed vegetables, cilantro and radish. This taco was really tasty, fresh. A perfect combination with the chipotle sauce. Quite a large taco: I had only 1, felt fuul. 2 would be more than enough for a lunch.

My mother had the enchilada (grilled fish) and she had a blast.
A huge plus for the Mexican coleslaw (Fresh onion, cilantro, bit of cabbage, peppers, zesty seasoning...so good and refreshing!).

Good and fresh ingredients, lot of option, friendly staff. Highly recommended!
author: Sylvain B.

description:
This is TMI but I need to give y'all a warning!!! Don't eat here this place made me and my friend sick the meat is not cooked right we ordered the beef nachos Asada what ever it is just don't me and my friend had the runs I wanted to barf after we left this place we called the doctor and since we only ate our here that day (because we got sick) my own doctor said it was from there food just yuck man I regret going in here I was walking down this street it looked cleaned but overall the food did not taste good the meat was hard like rubber it literally had no flavor should have went to another restaurant omg whyyyyyyyyyyy
Updateee!! Business owner replied to my comment and to the business owner look and read carefully food poisoning doesn't happen right away but did I state the day or how many days after or when I called the doctor ?? Your not a doctor how do you know it wasn't your food next time don't use google to determine who gets sick from rubber beef that you served please call Kaiser and a real doctor. I understand that you have to defend your restaurant from my review but listen u didn't cook the food well it had no taste regardless of what you goggle or state I am entitled to my experience. I said I wanted to barf I said we got the runs did I say I actually barfed ? Did I say when the runs occurred, do you know what doctors do they run test they sit down and find out the source of what you ate what is out of your routine what is the time from like one that went to medical school not one that goes on goggle. Please don't continue to make another review and respond to me don't waste your time.  My reviews are all legit and actually experiences regardless of passing a one day inspection that doesn't come every day only how many times a year does it mean the day I came to your place your food was cooked right ? Thank you ladies and gentlemen...
author: SN N.

description:
Walked around the marina district cow hollow to look for a quick bite of food. Walked this place today and I realized I never seen it before so I decided to come in to try their food. This is a definitely an Americanized Mexican restaurant where most of the menu caters towards white Americans. The interior is very simple with tables in the front but you must order before you sit down. The menu is simple, not many option but definitely enough options to make a choice. Me and my friend decided to order the NorCal burrito which is beans, choice of meat, gauc, pico de gallo, and instead of rice, it's makes with potatoes. We also got a street side and chips salsa, & gauc for $7.95. This is definitely overpriced because it comes with way too much dip and not enough chips. The burrito came and I split it in half with my friend. The meat is very tender and juicy which I really liked. On the other hand, the potatoes replacing the rice in the burritos is something different. Other than that, it's not really special. You can definitely get something better in the excelsior district for a much better price. 
I'd come back for the tacos and tortilla soup.
author: Lisa W.

description: Tiny hole in the wall with very simple but tasty Mexican food. Some vegan / plant-based options as well. You have to be lucky to get a seat but the atmosphere is welcoming and warm. Loved it!
author: Aurélie M.

description:
Unexpectedly much better than I thought it would be! Me and my friends initially tried to get brunch at some of the more popular restaurants in the area but the waits were way too long. We settled on having lunch here since there was no wait and was empty seating. 

For $13, I got a huge fajita rice bowl that was delicious! It was super filling and came with chicken, grilled veggies, Mexican rice, black beans, lettuce, cheese, salsa, and guacamole. Pretty amazing deal for SF! If you aren't hungry, I seriously think you can feed two people with this order. I was really happy.

We also ordered sangria, which was really good. Very fresh and well made.

Overall, agreeing with others that this restaurant is underrated. I would definitely come back for a quick, hearty, and affordable meal.
author: Sophia H.

description: My girlfriend and I got very, very sick after eating here on 2/20. Food poisoning is an understatement! It tasted rancid and reheated, not fresh at all. There are lots of great options nearby, won't be returning and will continue to warn others to stay away!
author: Barry B.

description: On April 24th I visited Bonita and had the worst experience so far. The cashier was friendly but for some reason every time I order here my order is messed up in one way or another. I am allergic to dairy and ordered their Nor-Cal burrito without any cheese or sour cream. I received my order and went on my way, in hindsight I wish I'd checked my order before leaving. When I went to take a bite my burrito not only had cheese but sour cream as well, on top of that they had given me their basic burrito instead of the one I had ordered and paid extra for. In addition to that I was sick for three days after ingesting such intense dairy content. Every time I order my food to-go from Bonita they give me the basic one instead of the one I pay extra for. I don't know if this is a common theme but having this happen three times is more than a coincidence.
author: Diana R.

description: I ordered food for delivery. I got guacamole and chips and a carne asade bonita burrito. The food I got was good, but the order was inaccurate, delivering a chicken burrito without any of the "Bonita burrito" toppings. Just a bummer since I paid extra for the more elaborate burrito haha
author: Jamie Z.

description:
I am very disappointed at this place.

I ordered a burrito bowl with just rice, cheese, sour cream, carne asada and chicken. Plain and simple. Apparently not simple enough because they messed up my order 3 times. All my friends were done eating and my food was still getting remade. It was pretty awful. The manager or guy in charge was somewhat apologetic, but seemed annoyed when it really was their fault. It would have been nice to comp the food since they messed it up 3 times, but not all restaurants have good customer service, I guess. To make things worse, when I got my food, it was so bland! I was so disappointed. The food was just not good. I did not even finish it even if I was pretty hungry. It's also very overpriced.  I paid $24 for a burrito bowl, Mexican corn and horchata. 

The only reason I'm giving them 2 stars is because the elote (Mexican corn) and the horchata were delicious, otherwise my visit at Bonita was very disappointing.
author: Em P.

description: Honestly I love this place; it's this cute and colorful taqueria on Chestnut in the heart of the Marina. Their burrito bowls are to die for, like soo bomb! You get such a big bowl & be sure to put their salsas that are on the tables in the bowl. Also the Fresca and Horchata are good too. If I lived closer I would go once a week. Tastes so fresh and fills me up for the whole day. Soo good
author: SA M.

description: Great spot to pop in for a causal lunch or dinner with chips and guacamole and a great burrito!  Really cute outside space. Also, a great place to order takeout/delivery.
author: Hillary S.

description:
guac&chips, baja shrimp tacos, and an agua fresca watermelon w/ a shot of patron...on a Friday.  done.

also cute little alley way perfect for your own mini fiesta
author: Melanie D.

description:
Best rotisserie chicken I had. Really juicy and moist meat, even with the breast meat.

Ordered the Clasico Quesadilla and it had a home made feel to it, not like franchise Mexican joints. Tasted good also
author: Alvin S.

description: We LOVE Bonita. We are both vegetarians and get the bowls but they have plenty of meat options. The service is always great, love the little outdoor alley, great portions for a fair price. Our favorite place to stop for a filling and healthy cali bowl before biking over the bridge. Thanks for the great food and service!
author: Georgia H.

description:
Fist of all it took them forever to understand what I wanted to order and they still didn't get it right. 

I ordered carnitas tacos and ended up getting chicken tacos. Didn't realize this until I got home. 

Their meat was so dried out it was not edible. 

Their rice was burnt and also dried out. 

Would never go back here.
author: Caitlin M.

description: Cute little place, not too vegan friendly if you're a strict vegan but does offer plenty of vegetarian options!
author: Massiel S.

description: They have the best salad in the Marina. Sorry Blue Barn, the plant, Pluto's etc. This one tops them all. Pumpkin seeds, radishes, black beans, with their rotisserie chicken and avocado. Topped with a cilantro dressing and all of their salsas. I've literally been eating it 10 days straight and I encourage anyone to try it and see for themselves.
author: Amit D.

description:
Service: 5/20 @ 9:30pm. Not interested in anyone period. Turned away @ least 10 patrons in 10 minutes saying they are closed. On a Saturday. One couple was so uncomfortable they ate outside in the cold rather than have the wait staff stare at them unnervingly. 
Food: COLD chicken tacos. Only chicken was available. Server asked if we thought we could finish our drink in 10 minutes; otherwise he wouldn't sell it to us.
It was disappointing, especially because a local recommended it as one of the best tacos in the area.
author: Carrie B.

description: Not bad not amazing. Tried the fried fish taco, has nothing on Nicks. Wifey had the chicken taco, she didn't really say anything so I imagine nothing amazing there either. But the star for us was the cheese quesadilla. Loaded with cheese and very large. The elote was ok, kindof expensive for what you all get, but to be expected in the area. We may come back if we happen to be here otherwise it's a pass for us.
author: Guisela L.

description:
My friend once told me about a joint in the Marina that served some really good Mexican bowls. I'm always up for trying new spots in my hood, so we came to this quaint eatery one night. 

First off, the place is pretty small so come early or expect to share table tops with others. There's a big bench style table in the middle and can fit a few parties. I like that the tables are stainless steal, easy clean up. When you enter, you go to the back, order your meal and they'll call you when it's ready. The menu is on a big lit back board and easy to ready. 

For dinner, we got the best value in my opinion! The Bonita bowl for $10.95 and chips and salsa side for $3.50. The chips and salsa was HUGE! It was served on a rectangular platter with guacamole and salsa, lots of it. Then the bowl. OH-EM-GEE, what a gigantic serving! Served with your choice of meat (I chose Rotisserie chicken), rice, beans, pico de gallo, cheese, sour cream & guacamole. This was such a great deal and the flavors were great! Lots of protein so you know it was worth the price tag. Loved it! 

If you're on Chestnut, have a left into this joint and you'll be surprised how much food you get for the amount of money you pay. Definitely coming back!
author: Rockne H.

description: Great magi burrito, friendly fast service. Be sure to try the chipotle salsa. Great patio out back too!
author: Sarah A.

description: Small and crowded, but 3 of us managed to get stools. Had the mahi mahi and shrimp tacos. Both were good.
author: Jason W.

description:
Were you to peruse a list of things I like you'd find, very high on that list, a) an excellent salad and b) superior carne asada so when I find both in a single location it's something I get seriously excited about.  Enter Bonita Taqueria Y Rotisserie, an overwrought name for a tiny Chestnut Street storefront in San Francisco's Marina district.  

BTYR's meal-sized salad, La Campesina Ensalada comes close to perfection.  The salad is big, fresh, and filled with fork-finds like pumpkin seeds, avocado, roasted corn, black beans, and cotija cheese.  The addition of excellent carne asada, for a few dollars extra, puts the salad into the category of things I'd gladly return to on a weekly basis.  
 
With its Marina location and a crowd straight out of Marina District Central Casting it's obvious that this isn't an authentic Mexican taqueria.  It's a busy little hive packed with bar-height counters, backless stools, and lots of young beer/margarita drinking patrons who you'll eye-plead with to please vacate their stools before your food is served.  

Despite the salad, not all menu items are created equal.  BTYR was the first place I ever had an ear of Mexican corn (elote) which I disliked.  I'm also not fond of the fact that chips and salsa (pico de gallo) are not provided gratis.  A spicy margarita was delicious, with significant chunks of colorful peppers but no evidence of actual tequila.  These seem like mere quibbles however; as the La Campesina Ensalada with carne asada was that good.

With Tacolicious on one end of Chestnut, Mamacita on the other, and BTYR sitting in between there's some serious competition here for your Mexican-ish dining dollar.  If you're looking for a fast, casual dining experience and an excellent, filling salad for under $15 I'd recommend giving BTYR a try.
author: Tracey A.

description: The food was good but not spicy enough. The "hot" sauce was more of a medium and the quesadilla was a little bland. It was still delicious and a solid meal though! However, the alley next to the place was beautiful. Staff was kind and food came out fast.
author: Gurleen V.

description: My friend and I ordered a bonita bowl, an order of the machos nachos, and a couple of tacos for pickup. Unfortunately, we did not enjoy our experience. The chicken and rice were both really dry and hard, and the beans tasted sour, which made it seem like it had been a couple of days old. This made us think the food was not fresh, so we did not come close to finishing our food. To cap it off, both my friend and I had gotten food poisoning. I had been here once before with another friend and couldn't remember much about it, but this trip made it memorable.
author: John A.

description: I've been here on numerous occasions because, due to its location, I always want to love it, but I've never once had a pleasurable experience and I'm done trying! The drinks are AWFUL!! They are way too sweet and just taste like mix. In addition to that, the staff are rude. I strongly encourage you to take your money and time to any of the other choices on Chestnut Street.
author: Natalie L.

description: Chicken and prawn burrito... did not care for it.  The prawns didn't taste good and weren't cooked done enough.  Asked for sour cream see nortaste any.  A wee bit expensive for the quality.
author: Kathy W.

description: Food is mid grade, walked in at 9:54 and they told me they were closed‍ if u coming they don't close at 10, 9:54z
author: Jasmine C.

description: Came here for a quick lunch and was pleased with the food and the location. I got here about 1:30 so just after prime lunch time and it was still relatively busy. You order up at the front and they bring the food to where you are seated. It was a bit pricey for the portion but I was on chestnut st so it was not surprising. I sat outside in the alley way which was great, sun shines right through and it blocks out the wind. I went with the be carnitas greet tacos. They were exactly what I expected, small but packed some great flavor in the meat. The sauces were very good, I preferred the habanero out of the three provided. I would definitely come back to try out more of their menu and to have a full lunch.
author: Josue V.

description: This place is one of my new favorites, loved everything from the food the cute vibrant outside dining area.
author: Ana G.

description: Tasty food and quick service! My only complaint is that their salsas aren't very good. The chicken, beans, and all other ingredients are great.
author: Yonni M.

description: Ordered 2 tacos for delivery. Delivery time was good and the tacos were good but they could have been better. Never had a place use ONE tortilla for a taco and ONE slice of lime for 2 tacos... interesting. They could have wrapped the tacos in foil or something to keep them warm and from going all over the container because everything was a mess when I received it. It looked more like a taco salad with two tortillas thrown around, than 2 tacos. Oh and they were cold! Probably not ordering from here ever again.
author: Angela L.

description: Great burritos for the price & friendly staff.    I enjoy the vegetarian burrito & I get the NorCal for the hubby.
author: Breana W.

description:
I'm definitely a fan of Bonita! Not sure why the rating is so low but It's pretty much an upscale Chipotle and they give you great portions! 

My first time here, I ordered the Bonita bowl with your choice of Carne Asada, Rotisserie Chicken, Carnitas or Pastorcito, Rice, Beans, Pico De Gallo, Cheese, Sour Cream & Guacamole - $9.95. Really good and refreshing and definitely not too heavy. I wish they added more rice but other than that i was really good. The Frisodilla is pretty good too.
author: Jenn L.

description: LOVE LOVE LOVE THIS PLACE, although the seating is sort of annoying cuz its cold, the food is amazing. Get the corn on the cob, the friscodilla, the campesina salad, and the burrito. ITS SOOOOOO GOOODDDDD. The salsas are amazing as well as the chips and guac.
author: Rebecca A.

description:
I'm going to be honest, the first time I went to Bonita (literally the day they opened) - I was not a fan. I tried their Rotisserie chicken and it didn't do its name justice. 

I gave Bonita another shot a couple of months ago, and this time I tried their tacos. BIG FAN! I would highly recommend their Pascarcito, the meat is very flavor and tender and that taco hits the spot. They also have a really nice outdoor seating area which gives you the feeling that you are in an alley in a foreign country - especially great on a nice day. 

Good food + Beer. Why on earth would people go across the street to that one place?
author: Tarun P.

description: This restaurant is so good! Too often in gentrified areas people open up "taco shops" that serve mediocre gourmet tacos 2 for $15 or something ridiculous along those lines. This place is NOT like that! Good and authentic Mexican food made by people who definitely know what they're doing! Not to mention they have ELOTES! We got the whole rotisserie chicken for $25 and it was enough for 3 of us to share, and it came with tortillas, rice, and beans. The guacamole was $7 for a decent portion with chips and it was freshly made and delicious! The margarita and mojito were delicious as well! Definitely recommend!
author: Kayla S.

description: This burrito was really oily and made me sick.  Had to explain my order to them about 5 times and was still nervous they got it wrong.  No veggies available here.  Avoid.
author: Tom T.

description:
I went to Bonita Taqueria looking for a somewhat small meal and, boy, was it small. I got a veggie taco ($3.95) and it was really teeny; for $4, I would have expected slightly more.
 
As as a vegetarian, I make conscious decisions to have as much protein as possible in each meal. I got the veggie taco because the description ("Caramelized Peppers and Onions, Roasted Corn, Pumpkin Seeds, Refried Black Beans, and Cotija Cheese, Topped With a Homemade Tomatillo Salsa") includes beans (and because it was one of the only three vegetarian options). When I got the taco, however, I was very disappointed to find only a hint of beans.

I could be convinced to go back and try the clasico burrito bowl, but I would not get another taco as I don't think it was worth the price.
author: Stephanie D.

description:
Their friscodilla is really good. 

Surprised more places don't up their quesadilla game like this. 

They add corn and bell peppers and I don't know what else. 

It's a full meal though. 

Ask for the pico and guac on the side if you are taking it to go so it doesn't sog it up.
author: Cecil C.

description: Burrito and tacos were amazing. Love the potatoes in the burrito  Super cute place. The alley is a cool spot for pictures.
author: Jackie L.

description: I don't know what some of these people are talking about. The workers here are friendly, ordering at the counter is easy and they usually bring out the food fairly quickly. I have only had the street tacos and chips and salsa, but they're pretty good, especially the pastorcito tacos.
author: George M.

description: Been here once, will not be back even though it's right up the street.  Ordered a burrito bowl and I left 1/3 of it because it was so mediocre.  I don't think any of the ingredients were seasoned and the lettuce turned to mush.  Not sure why they would have put that on the bottom.  And it's not cheap.  Burrito bowl and a coke cost $16.
author: Rich K.

description:
This small spot keep changing businesses more than I can keep up. In comes a taqueria that also cook and specialize in rotisserie chicken. Indeed the concept fits perfectly in the Marina.

On my debut of the new taqueria, I had the same rotisserie chicken bits and pieces in my burrito, wihich is called "Nor Cal" burrito. For a $9.95, I get the fresh meat, rice, sour cream and guacamole in a flour tortilla. Though quite pricey, the rotisserie chicken is a difference maker in my "silver-bullet". I also get fresh chips and used the home-made red and green sauces. My burrito: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/bonita-taqueria-y-rotisserie-san-francisco#DgeXjNYdTdACpYtaHumA4Q

With my burrito, the new spot also serve three beers on tap. In which I took the Lagunita IPA for $5.00. Beer and burrito are great combos. 

Though it is pricey and paying Marina District's prices, the burrito is not bad. And the service was very efficient. I will definitely come back and try the tacos and other food. Hopefully this taqueria will stay!
author: Matt G.

description: Love this spot- high quality food (e.g. Mary's chicken) burritos, FRISCODILLA, elote, tacos too- they all hit the spot. The Campesina salad takes on any other salad on the street. Refreshing fast casual space to sit and enjoy and the staff is awesome! Nice spot to grab a beer or wine (sangria!) with your meal. Also great takeout option.
author: J K.

description: Service was amazing and fast. The food was delicious and priced well.  When placing our order we were helped with suggestions.  Sure glad we took his advice.
author: Dave T.

description: Customer service was less than accommodating. Ordered the fajita which was $16 and comes with 2 sides. I was really wanting corn on the cob, but thats not a side you can get apparently, but even when asking if I could just have that ONE side instead of 2 sides the answer was weirdly "No".  Especially disappointing when the menu says that each side is $5 and I'm willing to only get one instead of the 2 it comes with. Salsa size on to go order is tiny, like an oz, so ask for multiple. It was 48 degrees outside and they wouldn't close the doors so I had to order it to go.  Tables were covered in food and even when patrons were visibly trying to sit down and wipe them off no one came to wipe them down. There is so much amazing inexpensive Mexican food in this city that if you want regulars you have to have good service, fresh food and reasonable prices. This place could be better with some changes.
author: Kara B.

description:
Going on my 25th minute of waiting for a simple chicken burrito so I figured I'd pass the time by writing a review and putting forth the possible reasons why it takes so long to make a burrito in any case let alone a moderately busy place with little seating, no line, and as I watch two women that came in 10 minutes ago get served their tacos. 

Asked the server what's going on with my burrito and he's checking but his preliminary response is equipment problems. Yes, of course. 

Maybe their New Year's resolution can be to get new equipment or else stop farming the chickens out back because it's taking too long to make a simple chicken burrito. 

Funny now it appeared 5 minutes later. Hopefully it's worth the wait but that's fairly hard for a burrito to overcome no matter how good. Maybe Papalote can pull it off but even that's a stretch.
author: Michael K.

description:
This review is based on 2 different experiences in the past week:

The first time I came here, I was craving a burrito. Tacko is my usual spot, but since Bonita is new in the neighborhood I wanted to give it a try. I ordered the Bonita burrito with rotisserie chicken. The idea of the juicy flavorful rotisserie chicken as the meat made me so excited. But truly, this burrito was a letdown. Granted, I ordered it without cheese or sour cream because I have a lactose allergy. But still, I've had great burritos that lacked those ingredients. This one just seemed to lack flavor. I wouldn't recommend the black beans in a burrito - how about an option for whole pinto beans?? Also, the chicken. Sadly, it lacked the flavor, and it also had a giant piece of gristle in it which grossed me out.

Based on this burrito, I'd give Bonita a 2-star rating.

BUT, they did redeem themselves somewhat. 

If were up to me, I probably would NOT have given them a second chance. But a friend in town wanted a burrito bowl, chipotle style. Since there are no Chipotles in the Marina, the closest thing I could think of were the burrito bowls at Bonita. So I begrudgingly gave them another try. 

This time I ordered the salad and topped it with carne asada (and warned my friend against the chicken - he ended up ordering the bonita burrito bowl with carne asada). Both the burrito bowl and the salad were very generous portions and both very tasty. I'd recommend the carne asada, much more flavorful.

So based on the salad and burrito bowl, I'd give Bonita a solid 4-star rating. 

Given the two vastly different experiences, I'm gonna average the two and call this place a 3-star. But they could sway me with more good food to up in to a 4 in the future, so stay tuned for a possibly update.
author: Krista S.

description:
Small place....long seating table/open window seating area for those who wants to dine in but you'll have to paid for your food first at the cashier if you want to dine in.

Open kitchen so you can actually the cookers cooking. Only one worker who deal with the cashier and bring out food so it can take a while for the person to get to you if you're waiting to order your food especially if that worker is busy

I was craving quesadilla so decided to come here. Got the classic one with chicken and guacamole but it'll cost extra if you want to add the chicken. It would have been 9.95 before tax but they gave $0.99 cent discount which made a little cheaper. Wasnt sure why the cashier gave me a discount but i aint complaining about it. Food came out quick but the food itself was only alright. It is big enough to get you full.
author: Julie N.

description:
Cockroach. Order # 147810.
I opened the Bonita bowl and found a cockroach running over the top of the meal.
author: John F.

description: Came here for the first time with my dad for lunch, and was highly impressed! Some of the best tacos I have ever had!! You can't go wrong with whatever you choose. I got the steak tacos and they were full of flavor. My dad got the Baja tacos and ended up getting more! This is a must go in the Bay Area!
author: Joe D.

description: This place is bombaf. I love getting the rotisserie chicken with sides to share family style... but I'm a big fan of the friscodilla! I sometimes wish they had a salsa bar but this place is good people and great food
author: Jake R.

description: Bonita is delightful. I really like that the dishes are not heavily seasoned. Instead, there are several housemade salsas that you can apply to reach your preferred heat level. So I was able to bring my friend who can't tolerate a lot of spice, and he could still try anything on the menu. And I could have it as hot as I liked. You don't want to come too late, as everything is fresh and they may run out of things as the evening progresses. I love the Elote (roasted corn on the cob)! I've tried about half the menu and failed to find anything I didn't like. The alley on the side of the building is very festive with a number of 2-seat tables. The main area inside is stools at a counter. Service is friendly and usually pretty quick, depending on what you order and how crowded it is.
author: Charlie G.

description: Overpriced horrible quality Mexican food. Not much thought put into the menu. There was a big bone and cartilage in our burrito. Classic tourist trap.
author: Jonathan S.

description:
I ordered the Clasico Nachos and an asada Bonita burrito.

Nachos were very soggy. Every single chip was wet and disintegrating on the box. Either they were very cheap on the cheese or didn't put any, not quite sure. The pico de gallo was good, probably the only "good" thing I ate.

The burrito is made with box rice and canned beans that had no flavor. The guac was plain, I'm not even sure it was guac, maybe just mashed avocado. The asada was pretty flavorless but had some decent chunks of meat. The tortilla was crisped nicely.

There were 3 salsas, all pretty weak. One was very spicy, but as with the rest of the meal, was flavorless. The other 2 salsas aren't even worth eating. No flavor, no spice. I don't even know how it's possible to make flavorless salsa but they managed to do it, twice.

Overall I was dissatisfied. I'm from the Central Valley where you can get excellent Mexican food from almost any corner, gas station, or taco truck and for half the price. It's obvious that this place is taking advantage of its customers by up-charging canned food in this expensive city.
author: Carl W.

description: Quick service and good choice of relatively healthy food prided reasonably for this part of town.
author: Victor B.

description: The food is stale and flavorless. It's not the worst ever if you're craving Mexican and don't want to go far, but there are far better options in San Francisco.
author: Nitesh Y.

description: I feel that every time that I come here I get the best burrito & the best service in the Marina!
author: Monica D.

description: I don't know how I've never noticed this place. I ordered a veggie taco and a Baja fish taco. Both were very tasty. A warm, welcoming presence by the lady taking my order. Probably my favorite part is the outdoor seating- I genuinely felt like I was in Mexico, bright colors, very nice (I went on a rare sunny SF day).
author: Sandi E.

description:
Eating here was like being strapped into a harness and doing acrobatics 100 feet off the ground (one of my other hobbies in addition to being a yelper)! Truly
Exhilarating! The burrito bowl (gluten free, I think) that I had was delish, and chips and guac (restaurant quality) are an absolute must as a starter. This place even had wine, so I walked out feeling hydrated and refreshed. I will be back. Thank you, you beautiful Bonita! Scrumptious!
author: Charlotte S.

description: HOLY HELL is their food disgusting. First we ordered from them and they messed up the order. They literally forgot the chips to go with the chips and salsa. Then they forgot the rice with my meal! Talk about a bunch of idiots. THEN to get to the taste of the food. Ugghhhhh so disgusting,  the pork was totally overcooked. When I called to ask for my correct order or a refund of their mistake they said they wouldn't help me and didn't care that I was writing a poor review for them. SOOOO go at your own risk!
author: Melanie B.

description:
Bad all around. 

Poor service:

Piled up a line up 6 people, didn't say a word at all, no "I'll be right with you guys" "thank you for being patient." 

Ordering:

Ordered a strawberry margarita pitcher and chips w/guacamole. The pitcher was ok if you like sour lemonade, but the guacamole was the worst I've ever had, pure acidic taste and the order of chips took 30 minutes (I wish I was exaggerating but I'm not.)

Bad service, bad food, bad drinks = a terrible place to go.

Do yourself a favor and skip this place.
author: Nic B.

description: This may be grading on a curve, but there was no good Taquria in the Marina for ever.  This place is bomb.
author: Mike W.

description: One of my favorite spots on chestnut. Always consistent, well priced, great portions.
author: Pariya G.

description:
This place is gross. Not much else to say. There's just something wrong with the food and flavors (or lack of flavor).  I've had a beef burrito here as well as the chicken bowl.  Both were bland and missing something- I just doused the whole thing in hot sauce to get it down bc I was hungry.
Down the street, there is Tacolicious, Los Hermanos, and Toma and Tacko a little further away for better food for the same prices as this place.
author: Kari L.

description:
Meh. It was ok. And definitely expensive for what I got. I had a rotisserie chicken taco for $6 and a side of black beans. Both were unspectacular.
I'd rather drive to the Mission and have loads of phenomenal food for the same price.
No, I won't be back.
author: Laurel L.

description:
It was rather fruititious that we went here...we tried two other locations that I had bookmarked on Chestnut but both were booked -- and this place didn't let us down.

My fiance is vegetarian and she loved her quesadilla and I ordered there ridiculously massive burrito bowl with rotisserie chicken. We also had a pitcher of the spicy margarita which was really really good...had a nice kick but not too bad, though admittedly we were all pretty buzzed already so our taste buds may not have been the best.

The one bummer was that there weren't complimentary chips and salsa.
author: Erik M.

description: A really good selection of food here at this restaurant. My friends and I got done exploring San Francisco and happened to be close to this restaurant. After having finished looking through Pier 39 my friends and I decided to come to this area. We looked at a few restaurants nearby but they were too packed and a long table wait time. Surprisingly this place wasn't as packed and the service was quick. What was more surprising was that the food was also really good. I ordered some nachos along with a few drinks for my friends and I. The alcoholic drinks here weren't watered down and the customer service was also extremely friendly. I love that they also speak Spanish! So if you have any friends who have a hard time speaking in English then this place is nice enough to go through the order and help find something delicious for you to enjoy. Thank you for having us there! I highly recommend this place to those who are visiting San Francisco.
author: Roselyn V.

description:
I've found my new favorite place for a salad in the Marina: Bonita.

La Campesina Ensalada with shrimp = bomb dot com.  It's a bit of an expensive meal because of the addition of the grilled shrimp (which sometimes can be a little too salty), but I love the way it actually fills me up and keeps me full with pumpkin seeds, avocado, corn, and black beans.  I like this a lot better than the Marina Girl salad at Tacolicious.

Their guacamole is bleh and disappointing.  Make your own and save your tastebuds.
author: Tori S.

description: I had the most delicious veggie taco here.  The ingredients were so fresh and I loved the combo of caramelized peppers and onion, roasted corn pumpkin seeds and refried black beans.  Their salsas - I had the mild and the medium were amazing too.  I loved it so much, I had another one when I was done.  I ate them in their cute outdoor seating area - it's very colorful and there was good Mexican pop playing.  It was like I too a mini-vacation to Mexico.
author: Jane L.

description:
To reference one of the greatest movies ever made, Bonita is a full on Monet. It looks way better than it actually tasted. Now, that doesn't mean I wouldn't come here again, it just means I have to temper expectations and evaluate my ordering decisions.

This place is by no means authentic Mexican. Think boutique Chipotle. Now that's out of the way.
The staff was incredible and the place is spotlessly clean.
Recommendation: Don't get fancy and stick with the tacos and I think you'll be ok.

I went with the burrito bowl with carnitas and it was a big ole mess of no flavor. I couldn't even finish it because the flavor combo just didn't jive well. The carnitas was fatty and seemed that every other bite was no bueno.

The others in my party enjoyed their meals citing four star reviews. The salad was fresh and delicious and the tacos were large and in charge, with a high five going to that fried fish taco.

Bonita would pass for some four star Mexican eats in New Jersey and NYC where Mexican is a bit harder to find (it's actually getting better). Here in San Francisco, I know you can do better, however I think you can do worse as well. I think Bonita will do well in its neighborhood, but I don't think you should travel far for this one.
author: Stephanie Y.

description: I have had the shrimp burrito and mahi mahi burrito.  Both are delicious. Order a side of the guacamole which is the best I've had since I moved to SF. I appreciate good food at a decent price and an order that arrives quickly and still warm. I will keep this place in the rotation.
author: Meghan M.

description:
Wow such a pleasant find. the chicken quesadilla gave the best cuts of chicken and perfect amount of cheese....very pleasantly surprised. Good price
For what you get...huge amt. guac was fresh.
author: Jenna M.

description: Was forced to return here by a group party and it was just as awful as the three times I went before.  Terrible food and pretty poor service too.  Inedible quesadilla, mediocre burrito and workers who don't like the place much either.  It's really just a place for tourists and visitors to the Marina.  No one who actually lives here will get near the place.
author: Bill S.

description: I wanted something casual and not packed for lunch and this was perfect. I came a little after 1PM on a weekday. The service was fast, and I was surprised by how flavorful everything was. I've grown tired of bland rice in burritos and my burrito here did just the opposite. The salsa, cheese, and guac in my burrito wasn't stingy and actually had FLAVOR. The employees are very nice and I love having the DIY water spout bc I'm perma thirsty, and I like eating on their little patio. They have wifi too!
author: Jane R.

description:
First off, do yourself a favor and read the negative reviews, it'll save you from a bad foodie experience. 

This place is a scam, the person at the front counter tried to sell me the most expensive burrito on the menu, as a vegan burrito. WTF no meat, cheese, or sour cream, and he said he was trying to help me. Uh yeah, help steal money from me. 

Save your money and read the negative reviews.
author: Pickle R.

description:
11.14.14 | bookmarked 10.28.14

Spicy margarita at $6.50. Awesome.
Street tacos at $6.95. Awesome.

Elote at $4.50. Not so awesome. Overwhelmingly limey and tangy. My mouth hurt a little afterwards from the citrus.

If I had stopped at the first two, it'd be a solid four stars for me. The meal as a whole, not so much.

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/bonita-taqueria-y-rotisserie-san-francisco?select=gDJJGBlJwNSTZy-TeUOw0Q#gDJJGBlJwNSTZy-TeUOw0Q

Total damage for two: $42
author: Jenny L.

description: This little taqueria is a gem in the Marina. I only got a 6" chicken taco which was delicious, but as I was ordering I saw the burrito bowls and they look amazing! I will be back to try them!
author: Nina P.

description:
Unfortunately this place really doesn't cut it for Mexican food in California. And it definitely should not claim to be a rotisserie.

Cute, colorful interiors and a good-sized menu are put to shame as soon as your food arrives. Burritos are meh, chicken is bad, and tortillas are like plastic. The one good thing on the menu (to my knowledge) are their burrito bowls. These are super hearty (think MASSIVE) and stuffed with rice, guac, cheese, meat, and mostly lettuce. While good if you're craving a bowl, not a burrito, it was still very average and had to be dumped with pepper to give it flavor.

If you're craving casual Mexican food, check out Tacko on Fillmore. Faster and 50x better. Hopefully Bonita will step up its game and bring on the casual-mexican competition!
author: Rachel L.

description:
1st!

Now on to my informed opinion.  Tasty little Mexican spot that just opened today.  They did a poor job hyping the place before it opened - nary a mention on the web until this here review.  No matter, the neighborhood is desperate for more Mexican so all is forgiven.  

Very good food at a reasonable price.  We ordered an assortment of tacos and the meat was prepared perfectly.  I found the guac a bit heavy on the lime and the table salsas unspectacular, but the food was so good on its own that both were unnecessary.

As of this writing, they have been open for roughly 4 hours so forgive the slower service and the chaotic food delivery as they work out the kinks.  Otherwise this is a solid place that should have Los Hermanos shitting their pants.  I am going back tomorrow.
author: Mr. Papshmir ..

description: Ehh over priced and the burritos are more tortilla then meat extremely dry with no sour cream .....Another thing the drink sizes are not worth the price
author: Kimberly F.

description: Hidden gem in SF Im glad we found this place I have gone back several times and still is as good as the first!
author: Tedd R.

description: I first went to Bonita to avoid a long line at Tacolicious. Now it's one of my go-to's. The tortilla soup uses amazing rotisserie chicken. Quick, delicious and kid-friendly.
author: Nate B.

description: Great little Mexican joint in the marina. My husband got 3 tacos and liked them all. Lots of flavor and great salsas you can bring to the table with you. I got the salad with carne asada. Tasted great...exactly what I wanted, light but filling. Sit in the small hallway-type patio to the right of the store front. Very fun.
author: Karisa G.

description: Cashier was super rude, it was actually insane that someone put her in front of the house with an attitude like that; everyone else seemed super sweet though. Bowls and burritos were super bland and dry butTortilla soup was decent.
author: mackenzie e.

description:
Great neighborhood spot!  I'm a big fan of their baha tacos and quesadillas. Their guacamole and chips is great to. Looking forward to exploring more of the menu.

The only thing I'm not crazy about is the uncomfortable seating.
author: Pina C.

description:
Wow! I feel so lucky to find this place. We were in the neighborhood to see the new Anti-Scientology movie, and stumbled upon this place.

The sangria is AMAZING!  All the food was delicious!

RUN...don't walk! It's that good!
author: Leesa S.

description:
I absolutely love this place! The price is in point and the quality is great! You go up to the counter and order then sit and wait for them to bring out your food. 

Their elote is so delicious, sometimes it can be a bit lime heavy but other times it's just right (: I've also had the salad bowl with al pastor. So delicious!!! The salad bowl is huge I was not able to finish it all so I packed it up to go. They have their salsa on the tables so no need to get all messy with pouring it into a small container. Water is self serve so you're not waiting on them to fill your water. 

The decor is adorable and there's an alley way that makes for such a cute and intimate date spot. the table are barely big enough for 2 people but that makes it so cozy.
author: Vivian L.

description: Don't waste your time here. If you ask for something like "no onions" the cashier throws attitude & pretends they can't make it that way. Food is average at best but WAY overpriced. There are plenty of other better restaraunts on chestnut to be wasting your money here
author: Niko A.

description:
I was in a bit of a hurry, so I had a quick meal here consisting of Mexican street tacos (chcicken), an elote (spiced corn on the cob), and a horchata to wash it down.

The tacos were OK.  Standard Mexican street tacos in my mind.  

The elote actually stood out with its spice. I thought it was strange, however, that this "side" at $4.50 was priced higher than the many of their tacos.

The horchata was also really good, but I thought the cup was a little on the small side.

I'll need to update my review after ordering the rotisserie chicken some day.
author: Sebastian N.

description: The portions of the Bonita burrito bowl with rotisserie chicken were huge, but also very bland. The ingredients in burrito bowls from Chipotle have 50% more flavor, forgetting the salsa.
author: Marc B.

description:
Nice little Mexican joint on chestnut, $2 Taco Tuesdays for street tacos. The street tacos were a little bland and roast chicken very dry but the sides made up for it. The sides were actually my favorite, chips, salsa and whole black beans, nice to see they had a brown rice option too.

Generous portions, friendly staff and quick service.
author: Angela L.

description:
We had a great experience here last night. 

The young woman at the counter was very helpful and friendly. She let us order our own concoction of watermelon agua fresca with coconut rum and it was DELICIOUS! 
I highly recommend trying it.

The food was delicious and came out quickly. The carnitas tacos had some sort of pickled onion that made the flavors pop. And the chicken taco was moist and very filling. The street corn was also full of flavor. 

The atmosphere is fun and casual and the music got me dancing in my seat. :) 

This is not a place for a quiet, intimate dinner but it's a great place for a tasty quick meal or casual meet up with friends.
author: Shannon M.

description:
Stopped in for an impromptu lunch and got the burrito bowl with carne asada. The meat was very tender and juicy.  Definitely recommend getting it.  People around us ordered tacos which looked pretty amazing too. 

Chips were served in a brown bag with a side bowl which you use to squirt salsa out of plastic bottles in to. They have red and green which were both great. It also looks like they have chili oil but I can't vouch for that. It's a unique was to serve the chips and salsa. 

It's a very small cafe. There are maybe 15 stools spread out around metal countertops/tables. Very cozy.
author: Whit C.

description:
If I was reviewing based solely on my dining experience the last time I came here, I wouldn't rate it very high. The margarita was too tart (legit all lime juice), and the street tacos were cold. The friscodilla with carne asada was the only thing we ordered that tasted good and was hot. 

However I've been here a few other times and had a better experience. Honestly I adore their chicken tortilla soup and regular quesadilla! Therefore I'll meet in the middle for this review and give Bonita another shot.
author: Teresa C.

description:
Ok so I have to put it out there that this strip alone was a treasure to be had. My boyfriend and I stumbled upon it during our city hikes a couple of days ago and decided to roam the city once again.

Feeling pretty hungry, and being that there were plenty of restaurants to choose from, the aroma alone stopped us in our tracks. We hardly even paused to check out the menu. We go in to a quaint eating area, to stand in line. Which wasn't so bad, because that gave us time to do what normal folks do at this day in age, we check them out on YELP, of course!  HA!

Service was pretty awesome being that we did get an apology for the wait, which actually wasn't so bad at all. I don't mind waiting especially since, I get to peruse yelp and the menu for options. I do have a "can't decide on what to eat" complex, ask the BF he will agree wholeheartedly. (Shrugs)


So the BF decided on the Nor-Cal bowl with rotisserie chicken, while I feasted on the Tortilla Soup, and Boy oh boy were we NOT DISAPPOINTED at all! Every last morsel was devoured! We shall be making a stop here again to try out the other yummy deliciousness! I also forgot to add the cute little pathway outside to the restroom, I wonder what it looks like during a lovely summer SF evening.....
author: Maria C.

description: Got the Bonita burrito with carne asada. Too much rice and very little flavor. I love burritos and usually am not that critical but I thought the burritos here were very average. Was a fan that they grill them though.
author: Chris S.

description:
Maybe I got the wrong item (or perhaps Mexican food in the Marina just isn't a good idea), but all I can say is the rotisserie chicken taco was drier than California's water reservoirs. 

You might be thinking, "WTF did you get a rotisserie chicken taco?" For a place that's called a taqueria y rotisserie, you'd think the rotisserie chicken taco is their specialty.

Hell nah. It was 90% dry, bland chicken, 5% refried black beans, 2% caramelized onions, 3% pico de gallo. So all you can really taste chicken wrapped in a tortilla with NO flavor whatsoever. 

I ended up dumping out the entire thing and taking the chicken from my boyfriend's tortilla soup  and putting it into the tortilla. Much juicier and flavorful, in my opinion.

The mahi mahi fish taco was alright. But I wouldn't go here if I had a choice, which I usually  do.
author: Allison C.

description: ABSOLUTELY LOVE THIS PLACE! Great food and margaritas! The spicy margarita is exttttra hot so beware! And the patio is the cutest - feels like you're in Mexico! Everyone walks by and takes picture of it and you'll want to too!
author: Natasha G.

description:
First time to this restaurant. 

I love a good fish taco...especially a baja fish taco. 

Ordered one baja fish taco and I was not disappointed.  The taco had a nice portion of fish that was well seasoned and not heavily battered.  The fish alone was already amazing...but what put it over the top was the aioli (can't remember exact name, but it's similar to cilantro).  SO. GOOD.  Definitely could have eaten a second one easily.  But, alas, I didn't.  Next time!  

Staff was friendly. 

Restaurant is small...but it shouldn't be a deal breaker. 

Only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because I want to see if the food is consistently good the next time I go back.
author: Pritika C.

description: I've gotten food here about 4 times now, and each time has been underwhelming.  Just not that good.  Especially for the price.  Most recently, I got the Bonita burrito w steak.   First, flavor-wise, it had no similarity to some of the more renowned places in the Mission.  Second, I'm always aware of the 'quality' of the meat... how much gristle is there, how sinewy are the bites, or for that matter, chunks of pure fat?  I understand we all have different preferences here, but this burrito was over the top.  I spit out probably 6 pieces of meat (sorry for the imagery).  It was either $12 or $13 after tip (I forget), but either way, just way too expensive for the quality and taste.  People are friendly enough.  Place is definitely a little tight.
author: Harris B.

description: Burrito was good but had a lot of chbones in it so didn't finish it...  The other person I ate with ordered the same thing but didn't have this problem so maybe this is uncommon for their food, I don't know.
author: Scott H.

description: Good burritos. Minus 1 star for bones in my burritos sometimes.
author: Ameet R.

description: What a find!!! The food is very fresh and delicious!!! I had a grilled mahi taco that was literally bursting with flavors! The place is quaint and cozy; and the people who work there are very friendly and helpful! I will definitely be back!!!
author: Sharon S.

description:
Thank you. It was very good. I had the Friscodilla and the cook was nice enough to cook my steak extra crispy. (Which I love) 

Thanks guys :)
author: LJ E.

description: If you want to talk to a super rude cashier and eat a burrito full of chicken cartilage, this is your place. The guy serving food was really nice (only reason for the second star). I only had a chicken burrito, so I'm not sure what their other food is like.
author: Alexander H.

description: Given that this joint is across the street from Tacolicious one would expect that the core items would be competitive in taste. Unfortunately the food is just OK. The side patio however is nicely decorated.
author: andrew v.

description: Awesome food at half the price of Tacolicious across the street. 4 kinds of salsa. Chips and guacamole were great. Plus agua fresca. Prefect spot for a quick bite.
author: Peter M.

description:
For what Bonita is, it is excellent .  I have had several great lunches here.  Although it is a bit pricy, the portions are generous, the food is FRESH,  the service is very friendly, and quick. 

On my last visit here I had the "La Campesina Ensalada" with Mahi Mahi. The salad greens were fresh, crisp and cool. The Mahi Mahi was marinated and grilled to perfection.  Per my request, the dressing was served on the side.  I balanced this out with a solid margarita (tough pour on the tequila, not too sweet, not too sour, fresh).

"If you want Italian, you go Little Italy. If you want wedding, you go Wang."  The Marina isn't really known for its authenticity.  If you want die hard, authentic Mexican street food, then scoot over to The Mission.  Otherwise, grab a seat at the Bonita, unwind with a Margarita, and some fresh Mexican food.
author: Erin J.

description:
Bonita Taqueria Y Rotisserie opened in my neighborhood and combined two things I like: mexican food and rotisserie chicken.  I have now been there 3 times and have had 0/3 good experiences. 

The primary problem here is the place calls itself a Rotisserie.  I ordered the rotisserie chicken and it was almost un-edible.  It had no flavor, the temperature was luke-warm, and the meat was rubbery.   Probably the worst Rotisseries chicken I've ever had in my life and I've been to some sketchy ones in places like Ecuador and Colombia.  Imagine a supermarket rotisserrie chicken left in a freezer for a month, then cooked by being boiled in water.  That's how it tasted.

The second problem here is the place calls itself a Tacqueria.  Unlike a 'Mexican restaurant', Tacquerias' tend to have very fast service and consistent quality.  I ordered a burrito from this place and it took 15 minutes to prepare, arrived cold, and was just a mess of beans, guacamole and congealed cheese bits.  There was no flavor of any kind even though I could see animal matter floating inside.  I only could eat half of it because I started feeling ill.  It was like I was eating old leftover guacamole and sour cream someone bought from the supermarket, wrapped in a tortilla.  Worst burrito I've had in San Francisco by far (I didn't know a bad burrito could exist).

After each bad experience, I say I'll never go back, but then I notice how crowded it is and trick myself into thinking other people must be onto something.  They aren't.  If you have been in California for more than 3 months, you'll realize this place is terrible.  My theory is the people inside are all tourists or drunk.

I never write reviews but this place is just so bad I had to.
author: Erik L.

description: The best horchata I've ever had! Loved the agua frescas as they weren't too sweet. The veggie taco was delicious, highly recommend, and two was enough for a meal. Also loved the Nor-Cal burrito, but they don't put much meat in it so that brought it down a notch. The black refried beans they use are SO good.
author: Diana C.

description:
The food isn't good enough to overlook the super rude service.  My favorite part was the response I got when I told the lady "I don't appreciate you blaming me for getting my order wrong... it's as if you don't believe in Yelp reviews!"  She said " I'M NOT WAITING FOR YOU TO APPRECIATE IT...AND I DON'T CARE ABOUT YELP!"  WoW.  

I went in for lunch at 2pm.  Only a couple other people in the restaurant because the lunch rush was well past.  I waited literally 15 minutes for my burrito.
