Wouldn't be a big deal if they were busy...but it was dead!  Anyway, I take one bit and realize all the stuff I asked them to leave out of my burrito was in there.  I told the same lady and she points to the menu board and tells me everything that comes in the burrito.  I was like...seriously?  There's nobody here... you don't recall me asking you to hold the beans, sour cream and guac...and you repeated it all back to me before submitting the order?  She turns away and heads to the kitchen to get my order fixed...with tons of attitude.  When she brings me the correct order I told her I didn't appreciate that encounter and that's when she got even ruder and said she doesn't care about Yelp! This place sux...stay away.
author: Mister H.

description:
Had lunch here last week and had a great experience overall. Atmosphere was low key with fun music and great seating in the side alley shared with the Squat&Gobble next door. Service was quick and super friendly.

My friend ordered a salad and one taco, I ordered the chicken tortilla soup. We got chips, salsa, and guac. Food came in large portions, but nevertheless delicious. It's hard to find a flavorful and filling chicken tortilla soup - but this was definitely one of them. Salad had chicken, taco was shrimp and both had just the right amount of seasoning. Having not realized how large the portions were, we couldn't even finish the food! 

From other reviews I've read, I have to agree that this is an underrated restaurant. I would definitely come back to try other items on the menu!
author: Tania D.

description:
Get the tacos. Get the tacos. Get the tacos. They are great. Seriously. You can even get your taco on a bib of lettuce to save some carbs. I have tried quite a few items on the menu and I have to say that the standout is the tacos. Marinated chicken or the mahi mahi. 

If it's a warm sf day sit outside in the alleyway. If it's cold get the tortilla soup. Its thick, flavorful and not too spicy.
author: Katie D.

description: I make sure to go here when I visit San Francisco. This place is mouth-watering good. The fajitas and the burritos are so delectable. I just can't get enough!
author: Nicole F.

description:
The secret to enjoying Mexican food in the marina is to have low expectations.

The food is overpriced for mexican food, but pretty on par with the new places that have been opening up in this area. 

I ordered a $10 carnitas burrito. It was actually pretty good when doused with the orange sauce they keep on the tables here. Still, it could have been a lot better.

My fiancee got the burrito bowl with chicken - which turned out to be gigantic. Unfortunately the chicken was relatively flavorless and even the sauces could only help so much.

The food came out relatively slowly - so while you have to order at the counter it takes a while to actually be able to eat here.

But at least they did manage to exceed my relatively low expectations. If a friend wants to eat here I wont complain too loudly.
author: Jeff L.

description: Ordered a burrito this weekend and was very pleased with the experience. Definitely a hole in the wall kind of joint, but a really great find on Chestnut! There are a few other mexican places around here, but this one is probably my favorite (Tacko's also really good too). I had a steak burrito and would rank it on par with a lot of the ones you can get in the mission. Definitely somewhere I'll go again.
author: Jay G.

description: Really good service, food is bomb and atmosphere is fun! There's a cute outside area to sit as well. Really good aesthetic for insta photos for anyone who is into that sort of thing! Definitely recommend.
author: Gina G.

description: Food is over priced. They took forever to bring out the food. I had to send it back because it was cold. They brought it back to me and it was still cold  The orchata is a joke
author: Lee A.

description:
I understand that this place is brand new, but I believe you must have a "recipe for success" if you are going to start a restaurant. (Pun intended)

I am currently in the process of eating a veggie burrito from Bonita. When I started talking to the "guy (seemingly) in charge," he explained that the brown rice is vegetarian, although when they first opened it wasn't. Something like this makes me skeptical whether it has really changed, since they've only been open a week-ish. Skepticism aside, I knew the burrito would be bad the second it was handed to me, because guess what? It was barely lukewarm. No orders before me and I was prepared to wait 10 mins for my food, but it came out cold after maybe 3 mins. 

To put things into perspective, I literally haven't eaten all day, and it's 8:30p so I will eat just about anything, which is why I took the burrito home anyways. Biting into the burrito, the rice doesn't look very brown to me, nor is it warm. The only thing vaguely warm is the refried black beans. The burrito might have all of the basic components you'd need, but zero flavor. I'm so hungry I'd thought I'd eat it anyways, but with every bite I'm questioning taking it back and just saying "here, I don't want this." 

Maybe I should have gone to Toma for nachos, all I wanted way something with a bit of warm, melted cheese!

IN SUMMATION: a cold burrito with no flavor for over $10? I doubt I'll ever go back. Or finish this burrito. Heck, I might need to go out and get something else to eat.
author: Krissi P.

description:
I think this place is relatively new? I hadn't seen it before. I got a Bonita Burrito with carne asada and really enjoyed it! Was a good amount of food and very tasty/fresh. My boyfriend got the street tacos and enjoyed them as well, although he was surprised they did not come with any salsa on them, we luckily said we'd like some when she asked while she was packing up our to-go bag.

We also got chips and guac and they were good too!
author: Alexandra W.

description: Had the carne asada burrito with an agua de piña and they tasted fantastic! Next time i come back to the bay i will be coming here, plus its a very nice environment.
author: Alan P.

description: The burrito bowls are huge, filling, and full of flavor. Love the addition of potatoes in the nor-cal bowl. Sold.
author: Cindy Z.

description:
Never going back!  
Got the tortilla soup to-go...big mistake, when I got to my house I realized the portion is prob abt 2 sips of soup, and 2 bites of chicken-for $10+.  Are you for real?
Called to let them know I was disappointed and rather than apologize or try to improve things, they asked me to bring the soup back?!!  You can have your measly soup and horrible customer service back.
author: Food E.

description:
Has everything you could want except flavor. Presentation, seemingly quality ingredients, but no trace of flavor. Post meal I am left with a sense of spice but even that is bland. 

Skip it unless you just need calories or basic nutrients.
author: Reed J.

description: My go to restaurant in the marina. Really good ingredients and lots of options. My recommendations would be the elote, tortilla soup, anything with pastorcito, and if you're trying to keep it healthy..salads or the Mexican cole slaw and rotisserie chicken.
author: Samantha C.

description:
The Elote and the Veggie Taco!!! That is why I am heading back. Everything I ordered was amazingly fresh and yummy. The food is what it is about people. 

Trust me - the best Elote, I have ever had. 

Yes, I saw a few opening week kinks. But the important thing to note if that they are trying to fix them. I saw quite a few people working together to get everyone taken care of and fix order mistakes. 

One quick tip to the owners: My friend had the Nor Cal burrito but the potatoes and carne were cut in too large of pieces that it made it hard to eat. She kept cutting up the potatoes with her fork and ripping the meat with her fingers.
author: Lauren H.

description:
I've become a bit addicted to their burritos (getting one per week). I work from home and go out for lunch around here often. This is by far the best burrito you'll find in this neighborhood (in my humble opinion). 

I'm addicted to the rotisserie chicken burrito with mexican rice.
author: Vlad B.

description:
Stingy with meat! 
Tonight was my first time ordering from Bonita. Staff is super friendly and the place is clean.
I ordered the Bonita Bowl to go with carne asada. When I got home and opened it was super disappointed to see about 1 tablespoon of meat! So I paid $10 for lettuce, beans and undercooked hard rice!!! If I hadn't already gotten home I would have returned it or at least complained in person.
author: Victoria R.

description:
Full 4 stars.

Finally, a decent taqueria in the Marina. I gave up on Los Hermanos and their yellow rice years ago. Tacolicious is fine, but I can get much better tacos in LA. When I'm in SF, I want burritos. So, when I saw a new rotisserie/taqueria had opened on Chestnut, I decided to give their rotisserie chicken burrito a shot.

Long story short, I was impressed.

The burrito had excellent structural integrity and ingredient distribution. They only have black refried beans, but these were delicious. The rice was well seasoned. The cheese (cotija?) was a little cold, which can be a downer. It worked here, however, providing little crumbles of seasoning like parmesan cheese on pasta.

The owners seem super friendly and eager to please. One suggestion if they read this review: consider renaming the "Nor Cal" burrito something else. I've never seen potatoes on a burrito in Northern California. Your other burrito (the Bonita?) fits that description better as it's pretty close to a standard Mission-style burrito.

That constructive criticism aside, however, I'll certainly be back.
author: Bigmouth A.

description:
Wow, Yelpers have it all wrong on this one! 

Came here the other day for the first time with the family, loved the food, and service was perfect. 

Good Rotisserie chicken is hard to come by and these guys do it right, loves the chilly oil dipping sauce. Only negative were the potatoes were a bit oily, I'll try the Mexican rice next time. 

5 stars for the quality chicken, it was excellent.
author: Sarkis S.

description:
We went to Bonita for lunch today realizing that it was open less than a week and would probably have some kinks to work out. 
The positives first. They have quite a large menu with reasonable prices for the Marina. The street tacos were well priced and had a good amount of meat. The burrito was also a good size and the staff was very friendly and accommodating. They have a trio of salsas on each table which had great flavor. 
We would agree with a previous review that the carne asada meat should
Be cut into smaller pieces as it was hard to eat in such large chunks. Most of the the food was really under seasoned and could easily be fixed but the rice was super oily and lacked any flavor. 
We will go back and give it another try once it's been open for awhile.
author: Tim L.

description: Small place to sit in but the food is absolutley amazing! I had the Macho Nachos and the plate was big, also had the street tacos and the beef was very tender. For drinks, we had a Michilada and Mojito and it was GREAT! Defenitly have to try this place! Great food, atmosphere and great customer service!
author: Jessica C.

description: Potentially the most underrated restaurant in San Francisco. I've been coming here for over a year, bringing friends and visitors, and have never been disappointed! The portion sizes are incredible for the price, the service is great, and the white sangria is to die for. Also the alley way provides a great background for a photo opp. LOVE YOU BONITA
author: Adriana W.

description: Is Great!! The service, the food and everything is really clean and organized... I don't know why google would not show up this place right when I was looking for one..I walked around and found it!! The best!!
author: Kari G.

description:
The tortilla soup is a great value. Huge bowl with tons of chicken.

Their burritos are pretty big, but they are pushing $12 when all is said and done which is just way too much for a burrito and the ingredients don't wow you enough to justify the price.

Tacos are decent sized.

You can sit in the little alley way outside which is kind of cool little hidden spot.
author: max m.

description:
Ordered the rotisserie chicken. Was very generic tasting and a bit overcooked. Coleslaw was utterly inedible and the potatoes soaked in grease and just shyte.

Won't eat there ever again and I suggest others just avoid this place.

On the plus side...the person that took my order was very friendly and attentive. Not her fault the food blows.
author: Drew W.

description: I like the friendliness and cleanliness of this place. Also food is not bad. Decent size and cool area to watch people. I been here only twice but I note my self to come after work when I am not hauling my ass every where one of these day. To also order a Bonita Bowl. That seem to be what my co worker recommended. Their half roasted chicken is good too. And their Carne Asada taco is sooooo good. Bucket of beer also a decent price. Not much of a beer drinker but my hubby is. Next time :)
author: S F.

description: I just ordered delivery from here and it's my first time eating here at all. I am SHOCKED at how AMAZING the food is. I ordered a Carne asada fajita bowl and i'm blown away. It's very large and filling. Perfect proportions of everything in it. Delivery was fast and easy. This is my new go-to place for lunch when I can't leave work. I'm definitely planning on stopping by the restaurant to try in house.
author: Paloma S.

description:
Man. I ordered ONE taco to go. Took 30 minutes! The hostess was clearly clueless, and the taco was so bland and mediocre that the whole experience really pissed me off.

With Tacolicious down the street, there is absolutely no good reason to go here.
author: Alexander J.

description: Awesome best crispy juicy salty (but really not too much) chicken in the area!
author: Saul F.

description: Incredible vibe, food, & outdoor yellow alley sitting! Pride is right for what you get. Value of each dollar is high here.
author: Matthew F.

description: Great addition to chestnut street! Fair prices good quality generous portions my go to place in the marina for Mexican!
author: Ilan K.

description: This place reminds me of a five star Taco Bell. So, the food is mediocre. The price of a carñe asada taco is almost $5.00. The food is very colorful and will satisfy your hunger. I had two tacos, chips and salsa and a Coke for $18.00. I should've went to the mission district to get the real thing.
author: Ernie G.

description:
Not quite sure why this place got some bad reviews. Maybe they were getting out their first week jitters. However, I went tonight and this burrito is delicious. So delcious that half way through I was thinking about how I need to tell everyone about this. Also, the service was very prompt!

I hope this place stays longer than the places before it!!
author: Alicia L.

description: had dinner there last night. service was excellent and the food very fresh and tasty. had the Bonita bowl. all five of us agreed.
author: Andrew C.

description:
Sigh.  Oh, Bonita.  Why do you do this to me?  

I was thrilled when this place opened up a mere 2 blocks from my apt.  I love me a good taco or burrito and it seemed like this place was going to be legit.  And it often is.  My first order here was the nor-cal burrito bowl (with potatoes instead of rice) and it was AMAZING.  The potatoes were gloriously soft, flavorful pillows that complimented the rest of the burrito bowl.  I was hooked.  

So why 2 stars?  It's the inconsistency of this place that drives me insane.  Some days, the food is spot on delicious - the chicken will be moist and juicy, the potatoes cooked perfectly, the spices on point.  Other times, it's a total flop - chicken is dry, potatoes are underdone. I've experimented with different dishes and some are more consistent: the carne asada burrito (or bowl, if you choose) is usually spot on.  Sadly, I have ordered this to go and - more than once - gotten home to discover they have given me a chicken burrito bowl instead.  UGH.  It's just so frustrating! I think that about half the times I've gone, I've been really happy with the food.  Which means half the time I've gone, I've been disappointed with the quality of the food or with the mix up of my order. 

Even though it's a few blocks farther up the hill, I'm going to Tacko from now on - a place that is consistently delicious and has yet to disappoint.
author: Jessica G.

description: Place isn't bad at all and I would recommend - I've eaten here about 7 times. It's nothing special but will definitely do the job if you are hungry and want some good Mexican food while people watching on Chestnut. The loaded nachos are great - especially with the rotisserie chicken. The Tortilla Soup is also pretty good. The salad and bowls were great at first but extremely salty - yikes. The burritos are so-so compared to a few of their neighbors close by. All in all it's fine but nothing special.
author: Chris D.

description: Alright 94123: we've waiting years for a place with staying power at this address. Pita Pit in 2008ish, Marina Kebab in 2010ish, Marina Bistro after that.  This address just couldn't get it together... Until now.  The chicken is damn good and the salad just bumped Blue Barn's tostada salad from its top spot.  They have Negro Modela on tap, and a TV with soccer on.  Let's rally behind this place and keep something open here.  I don't want to see Bonita shut its doors the way the others did.
author: Kari P.

description: Like this place a lot. Huge burrito bowls. Ingredients are fresh and tasty. Good selection of salsas. Cool side alley patio with tables. Happy to see another good taqueria in the marina.
author: Dante Z.

description: This place was ok but there is a lot of room for improvement. They don't really have the rotisserie part down. I had the chicken burrito. The chicken was dry and the black beans were overcooked and mushy. It is a good location it just needs to perfect the recipe. If you are the owner of this restaurant I would recommend that you go check out T's taqueria up at Lake Tahoe. That place kills it.
author: Alexander S.

description:
I got the Bonita burrito with carnitas, and - I've got to say - I was into it. The cheese was cheesy and the meat was meaty. I don't think it's the *best* burrito around, but certainly better than TOMAS in the Marina. 

Also - why do Mexican places serve bad tortilla chips? I want really thick or really thin, flakey chips with salt. Bonita's chips are hard and kind of bland. Boring. 

I will be back to try their other items.
author: Jeff M.

description:
I've had some pretty good fish tacos, but the one we had here were a step above the rest.  The baja fried fish taco was exceptional and totally different in ingredients to the Mahi Mahi taco. 

We also got the Guacamole and chips. Usually we'd expect a small bowl, but not here. The bowl of guacamole was very generous. Yum! 

We loved the food and service so much that we're planning on coming back for lunch tomorrow. 

This is not a fast food joint. Food is prepared fresh and was served within a couple minutes of ordering. 

Definitely recommended!
author: Bomun B.

description: Food is good but they will mess up your order 96 percent of the time. If you get the chicken or carnitas. Their other pork isn't good.
author: Maxwell B.

description: Best authentic style  Mexican food I've had in sf. I went with the 3 tacos for $7. The pastorcito meat was delicious and satisfying. Although I asked for no onions and still received onions, I'll gladly return again.
author: No W.

description:
FOOD POISONING!
Ordered: La Campesina Ensalada with Chicken
Date: 2/3/16 evening
The food tasted good, but I believe either the lettuce or chicken caused it.  I was extremely ill.  Beware going in.  It's too bad because they are in such a convenient place.
author: J W.

description: Excellent chicken! Ordered the quesadilla wth chicken and they put rotisserie chicken in it. Soooo good!!
author: Andrew Y.

description: Love stopping there on the way home. My wife likes shredded chicken, and theirs is awesome
author: Chris C.

description:
Had a great meal here last night. My wife had the fish tacos, which were awesome Mahi, and I had a Friscodilla, their take on a quest dilly with your choice of meat. I had Mahi mahi, and it was easily a meal. 

Tip: if you are there with another person,  and like Pico and guac on your meal, add an order of chips, Pico and guac. You'll have plenty for dipping and to slather on your entree.
author: David F.

description: Super excited to have a new Mexican place right near where I work. I got the street tacos and chips and guacamole and salsa. I was kinda bummed because I asked for 2 carnitas and one carne asada but they gave me 2 carne asada and 1 carnitas which bummed me out. I could have asked to have it changed but I was on my lunch break without much time so I didn't bother . The one carnitas was delish!! I loved it. The carne asada lacked a little flavor but still good nonetheless. Guacamole and salsa so good! The service was average. They seemed to know enough about the food. Overall I was pretty happy because it's good and fresh and right next to where I work so I'll be in a lot !
author: Madi N.

description:
This place is THE REAL DEAL. Their burritos come with guacamole, NO EXTRA!!! a girls dream...
Also the decor and music make me feel like I'm actually in a Hispanic neighborhood, not the Marina. Good job guys. Toma is in trouble
author: Tania C.

description: I have eaten at Bonita over 20 times. This place some of the best Mexican food I have ever had. The food is not super salty and the ingredients taste fresh. My favorites are the Bonita bowl/burrito and the quesadilla. I recommend the chicken for the meat. Service is fine.
author: Brian H.

description:
I order vegetarian tacos only. These are tasty, light, and very satisfying. My only complaint is that veggie tacos fall outside of their 3-taco deal. Come on, Bonita! Don't punish us, vegetarians! 

Oh, one more thing: not sure whether they are making their salsas in house or bring them in, but these are delicious!
author: J A.

description: 5 for the red sangria topped with hibiscus. 1 for the cashiers talking while my friend and I stood there waiting to order. Would have split the difference, but after making my friend's drink, they just sat there and talked. Again. Before I had the chance to order.
author: Brituhknee S.

description:
Such a great experience, I tried few items on the menu with a group if friends,from Tacos, Burritos , Rotisserie chicken and everything was fresh made with love... 

I highly recommend this place, you can taste the quality and freeness of the ingredients in every bite, add to that superior service and lovely staff and you have a receipt for a new landmark on Chestnut street .... 

A must try if you live in the neighborhood, and worth taking a trip if you live in a close by neighborhood, priced very well and the quality and freshness of the food is un questionable ... hope to see more restuants raise their standards

Definitely Bonita is  on my dinner/lunch list once or twice a week at least, I only write reviews for places worth taking the time and writing about them and Bonita's is definitely one of them.
author: Hashem K.

description: We tried it on a whim today and we were pretty happy with it. Our favorite taquerias are in the Mission but since we were starving and in the Marina, we stopped in. I had a shrimp burrito bowl and my son had a shrimp burrito. It was pretty big and damn good for $11ish It was fresh, the salsas were really good And I recommend the jamaica agua fresca. The workers were really nice! 4stars only because I spent $32 with tip at a taqueria for 2 things and a drink & I never do that....
author: bree m.

description: Bonita was the worst fast Mexican food experience I've ever had. Service and food were both terrible. I ordered a vegetarian burrito bowl. The flavor was terrible, the rice was sticky, the beans were undercooked, and half of the bowl was filled with lettuce. I ate a few bites and went up to the counter to tell them I didn't like it, their response was "you ate too much of it for us to refund you" and they wouldn't make a new one. They said the most they could do was make me a single taco or a side of chips. As humiliated as I was already, the lady at the counter took out her phone, snapped a picture,  and said "you're going to give us a bad review anyway so this will show that you didn't just eat a few bites." As a business owner myself and a local to the Marina neighborhood, I will never go back to this place.
author: Joshua P.

description: I don't do the tacos, just the rotisserie chicken. I had been complaining to my fiancé for months about the lack of a rotisserie chicken place in the neighborhood, and bam! Here comes Bonita. The chicken is always tender and juicy. I wish they offered more sides to choose from, but being a dieting bride to be, the chicken and black beans are a weeknight dinner staple.
author: Liz S.

description: Great food! I am vegetarian and I loved the flavor of the black beans and Mexican rice (is made with Chicken stock but I'm not strict). If it's busy, the service can be bad and take about 40 mins which is a bit much.
author: Lisi G.

description:
Fall favorites.

White girls love fall: http://www.buzzfeed.com/laraparker/things-all-basic-white-girls-do-during-the-fall

This guy also loves fall: Taco with pumpkin seeds, roasted corn, caramelized onions, black beans, cheese and homemade salsa. Enough to make two for $3.50. Delicious.

Even better was the Mary's half rotisserie chicken for $9. Accented with special spices it was big enough to top a salad one night and fill a burrito the next. Outstanding flavor.

Same friendly service and colorful logo were behind both. Space isn't very big so takeout might be the best option.

Might become a new favorite either way.
author: Jason B.

description: I love to come here for lunch because I love their burritos! Bonita burrito is my favorite. They're salsa and guacamole is okay. I also had their quesadilla which is somewhat bland. They have three different tabletop salsas to choose from which are super delish! Come here for the burritos!!!
author: Jamie W.

description: I want to recognize the Bonita staff for their professionalism. A few weeks ago I ordered delivery, but received the wrong order (it happens, no big deal). The man who answered the phone was very accommodating and said to come in any time for an order on the house. I decided to redeem that offer today. Although he wasn't working, his coworker didn't hesitate to help me. She had my order ready promptly and didn't charge me for it. I wish I got her name, and had more than $3 on me for tip, because she was so pleasant. And in case others are looking for general feedback on the restaurant, the staff is always on their game and the food is fantastic. Thank you Bonita! The food was awesome, as always and your cordial attitudes really brightened my day!
author: Tessa B.

description: great tacos...pastor was the most flavorful. upbeat music and their aguas are fantastic.
author: David C.

description: Haven't been in awhile and tonight I was reminded why. It's just not good. I got the street tacos and even asked which kind the guy taking my order recommended. He said, "the carne asada is really good." Wow, really good? It was SO dry and overcooked, my husband even commented that it looked a little gray. It was flavorless and chewy. My daughter got a shrimp taco. For $4.95 each, there were just two sad little shrimp in there. The corn tortilla was hard and looked undercooked. Chips and guacamole were fine, but that's the only positive. With Tacolicious across the street now, Bonita is really going to have to up their game. I, for one, will not be back!
author: Karen D.

description: Walked by last night and the place was pretty packed so we went back home and ordered on line. Got the roast chicken an assortment of tacos the macho nachos a side of rice and a quesadilla. Waited ten minutes then walked back which took about ten minutes. Stood in line for another ten minutes to be told it was almost ready. Waited another 15 minutes till we finally got our food. By the time we got home half the food was barely warm. While we were waiting for our order you could see him put an item in every few minutes and apparently it wasn't all cooked at the same time. Too bad because it was pretty good but would have been better if eaten freshly made. Some places just aren't worth getting take out and this is one of them. The place was very very busy with not enough wait staff. While we were waiting several people came up to the counter wanting stuff that was forgotten. Overall the food was decent. May try again to eat it there sometime but definitely would not recommend takeout.
author: Candia M.

description: Randomly walked by this place and popped inside for a bite. So glad we did! The food was amazing. The beverage selective had some interesting options. The service was fast, spot on and attentive. They let us charge our phones. I have recommended this place to several others who agree it's delicious.
author: Lauren C.

description: I would give it 6 stars if I could. Excellent sangria, burrito and guac. That's all I need!
author: A. A.

description: Much better than your average taco place, nice menu including large Mexican salads and fresh guacamole with homemade chips, right on Chestnut St with outdoor bar seating.
author: Peter H.

description: Gross food. Made me sick.  Never agsin eating here. Just not worth it! ! Seemed like a good idea at the time but it's just cheap food and not cheap prices.
author: Rachel J.

description: first time visit and it was convenient, the food was good, well priced, clean, and the service was friendly.  I'm a fan of Mamacitas (2 blocks away) but this is a great alternative if you don't want to deal with crowd or over priced Mex food.
author: Brian M.

description:
This is based on 3 visits in the last week. I had a mixed order of street tacos with pastorcito, carnitas and carne asada. The pastorcito meat was undercooked and under seasoned. There were big chunks of chewy, pink pork that were inedible. The carne asada wasn't fresh tasting and not very flavorful. The carnitas better in comparison, but still not very flavorful. 

The campesina salad was very bland. There is no punch to the salad dressing.

Between the salad and the tacos visit, I had the tortilla soup. It was extremely good. The broth is so flavorful and rich. My rating would be 4 stars if I based solely on the soup. The spicy margarita was also very good as well as the complimentary salsas available on the tables to pour over your food at will.

If I go back, it will be for the soup.
author: Erika B.

description: This is not Mexican food!! Lol the service was good but that's where it ends. The portions are huge. The food was so bland. No flavor whatsoever.  We will not be returning.  I knew something was off when they asked If we want brown or red rice. Also black beans on the menu. Ughh I don't think so. Traditional Mexican food includes red rice and pinto beans (brown beans.) This place wants to fool people into thinking it's a Mexican restaurant but it's not. Horrible place.
author: M G.

description: Open up take-out at home (Bonita Bowl) to find all additions paid extra for missing PLUS average included item (cheese) MIA...suspicious. Pricey disappointment. Would not even recommend to a foe.
author: Leah A.

description: Had take out. The guacamole was standard nothing too amazing. Chips tasted store bought not homemade. Ordered the carne asada bowl didn't realize till I came home they gave me the carnitas bowl...meat was extremely overly salty. Maybe it's still fixing it's niches but for now it's not worth coming back for.
author: Cristelle J.

description: Very exquisite Mexican flavor.. They have really good burritos and tacos.. Not to mention their street Elote.. Loved their customer service along with the cleanliness.. Would highly recommend to anyone who is in the mood for authentic Mexican food..
author: Eloy Figueroa L.

description: Apparently this location has changed names/owners quite a few times. I'd hoped this time would be 'the one'... Ordered the Chicken Fajitas, the sides were lacking (hello, where are the peppers, onions, something people). The chicken was a rotisserie 1/2 chicken, dry but decent. The sides (back to the sides), black beans and brown rice, that's it, no sour cream, peppers, onions, etc. We purchased guacamole & salsa to add flavor and a little depth. Super bummed this wasn't a better experience, hoping they can turn it around because their menu is very promising.
author: Michelle Q.

description: Delicious tacos!  Tonight was my first dinner at Bonita and I will be back a lot.   I had the mahi mahi taco and the veggie taco.  Both were delicious.   The piece of mahi mahi was cooked perfectly and a generous size, with delicious guacamole.   The roasted veggies included caramelized peppers and onions, corn, and pumpkin seeds on retried black beans with cotija cheese on top.  Friendly staff and very casual setting at long table or counters looking out in the chestnut street scene.
author: Nanette S.

description: Came here for dinner on a Saturday night. The place is pretty small but very cute. Food was very good, portions were large, and the salsa was delicious! I got the bonita bowl which was a great sized salad and almost couldn't finish it. Fresh, good guacamole, and great presentation. the only thing I would say is lacking is the front staff wasn't very pleasant. Other than that, will be back.
author: Britt T.

description:
Very disappointing. Had the tacos on consecutive nights. This was due to my not getting part of my order the first night. Returning, they agreed to make good and I ordered another item on the menu in addition.
None of their food has any flavor. No salt or pepper. Nothing. I guess they depend on diners seasoning with their hot chili sauce. And their taco shells can not be eaten by hand. They fall apart from being soggy.
author: Ken D.

description: Newly opened and a must try! I had the fish tacos and pastorcito pork taco. Very delicious and tasty. Guacamole is also really fresh and flavorful. Cute sit down and also perfect for a quick lunch run! Red sangria is delicious and they also have a spicy margarita. YUM!
author: Gabriella N.

description: If one wants a burrito, with meat, you have to order the one that also comes with cheese, sour cream and guacamole. Then they just omit the things you don't want but still charge you for what would normally cost extra.
author: Max K.

description: Really great addition to Chestnut! After Uno Dos left a void on Polk, my weekend taco game took a serious turn for the worst. Was super happy to see this place opened up and gave it a try yesterday. I got the carnitas salad (huge portion and tons of meat- seriously filling) and chips and guac. The guacamole was super fresh and light. My boyfriend ordered the nor cal burrito and said the potatoes were a bit off but that it was still really good. They have Negra on tap, the salsa is on point, and I love that you can sub a tortilla for a lettuce cup as a lighter option. We will be back!
author: Rebecca C.

description: Sloooooow service! Every time I have gone in, they are like turtles. Food is, eh ok. Too expensive for the quality of food & always cold inside.
author: Beth O.

description: I wish I give 2.5 for this place it was ok that's really all I have to say about it. The best part of the meal was the potatoes. I had the pastor nor cal burrito which I didn't even finish. Now if you know me know I finish my burritos no matter the size.
author: Jeremy R.

description: Wonderful lunch! We were in the marina during lunch hours on a Saturday. We got in this place randomly. We had some tacos. They were really good, especially the chicken one. People were nice, the place really enjoyable and no fuss at all. No long freaking wait time, no freaking  long lines and no freaking attitude of wanna be cool place. Just a good place with good dishes for a very good lunch!
author: Luca R.

description:
I was hoping this place was going to be a lot better. The Marina has some good Mexican options with Tacolicious and Mamacita's but it needs a quick fix burrito or taco spot for take out. I thought this would be that.

$10 for a burrito that is mostly filling and not much meat. I ordered Carne Asada Norcal Burrito. Couldn't tell you if the meat was good because there was so little I couldn't really taste it. Also, it was over filled with potatoes. 

Another observation: The person who designed this place must have been an amateur. You have the line to order blocking the kitchen so basically the staff bringing food to customers is constantly having to push through the line ordering so its just one big process of shuffling around while you are in the restaurant. It's nothing more than just annoying and the space is already tiny to begin with. 

I will probably give it another shot but for a first impression, it was a big miss.
author: Adam W.

description:
Average food, terrible service.

Ordered the "classic" burrito bowl: looks like a massively sized portion, when, in fact, it's just a big amount of lettuce underneath a tiny bit of chicken. Dry w/ no sauce, nor dressing.
author: P K.

description: Had the "El Norte". Very flavorful but the price was very expensive. Not sure I would pay $15 for a steak and prawn burrito with no chips or drinks again. I wish they had spicy peppers or anything spicy to satisfy my heat but not bad for a non ethnic burrito. The gringos should like it.
author: Carlos M.

description: Found this place by chance. After a long bike ride all day long happened to come across it. Did not let us down. Best tacos I have had. My kids both got burritos and they devoured them. The owner is very friendly and personable. I wish we had a place like this back in our town. I thought the veggie tacos were superb. Will definitely go back if we make it to the Marina district again.
author: Heather S.

description: The place has great food however it seems that they can't keep up. This is not the first time, both time they can't seem to handle the register. Causing a 30min wait for 2 people ahead of me.
author: Dara S.

description: I really like this place! Been here twice. Today I got the carne asada taco and it was delicious and flavorful. Also got a side of guac. Good food relatively inexpensive and quick. Nice addition to da hooood
author: Andrea K.

description: Best Healthy Salad in the Marina! I get the La Campesina Ensalada with chicken (Mary's free range). I do it without beans and cheese and Gaucamole instead of avocado with dressing on the side. The cilantro dressing is AMAZING - no added sugar or diary in it. The whole thing comes out to about $14 which is expensive to me but so worth it. Plus the people that work there are so nice!
author: Erica S.

description: big portions for the price in SF standards! perfect afternoon: elote, macho nachos and sangria in their super cute alley
author: Chelsea T.

description: I can only speak to the salad I got, not the tacos or burritos but it was fantastic. 4 stars because $14 is a little steep but also totally worth it. La campesina ensalada was the one I got and it had tons of warm shredded rotisserie chicken as well as corn, black beans, cotija, pepitas, tomato, radish avocado and a non-creamy (!) light dressing. Delish!
author: Carly K.

description:
It's the Marina folks, and the food caters to the local crowd: ie, more Californian/gringo, less authentic Mexican.

Despite this, I was elated to find good Mexican without having to drive to the Mission.

We each ordered the burrito bowl and it was perfect!
Large portions
Lots of fresh ingredients
Not overkill on the carbs
Perfectly grilled meat that was lean and tender
Awesome salsas to beef up the spice.
Dos Equis on tap
Fairly priced at just under $10 per bowl.
Friendly and fast service

The environment is casual, but clean and decorated simply with brightly colored walls and metal stools, outdoor seating too!
A great choice for affordable and casual on Chestnut. And you won't be hungry!
author: J B.

description: Very good tacos, chicken was tender and juicy.  The food and service are excellent.  Wish I lived closer, would love to try the Elote corn and more dishes.
author: Jody H.

description: Came here a few weeks after it opened. Had the Bonita burrito and guac & chips. Guac and chips were excellent - fresh guac and a very generous portion. The burrito however was not. In a city blessed with the best burritos in the world the Bonita falls well short. Lacking in flavor, spice and while large  is ultimately disappointing. If you come here don't get the burrito.
author: Mark W.

description: I really wanted to like this place. The menu is awesome. Unfortunately, the food is just bland!
author: Mary W.

description: Why did my burrito have the consistence and taste/smell of playdough?  I'm not speaking figuratively, it literally smelled like playdough!  I would have returned for a refund but was crossing the golden gate at rush hour when I found out.
author: Tom G.

description: Love this place! Just watch out for the jalapeños:) I've been there a couple times now and each time is still delicious! Love the outside seating in the adorable ally way.
author: Julia L.

description: This has become our go to spot for takeout or fast casual mexican in the neighborhood. Have almost had everything on the menu now and it is delicious!
author: Laura P.

description: This place is good and the ingredients are fresh. Love the low carb lettuce wrapped tacos. Not sure why it has an average 3 stars.
author: Arrian B.

description: Not great. Ordered a burrito bowl that turned out to be 90% iceberg lettuce. The salsa, guac, beans and chicken were in such short supply that it was hard to get get a bite with any flavor at all. They should call this item a salad. As it is, the name is very misleading. Not at all worth $15.
author: Andrew M.

description:
We were on our way to Pluto's and came across Bonita's.  We live in San Diego, so we are used to good Mexican food at reasonable prices.  My son like carne asada burrito's (he's 9,) but Bonita didn't have anything simple, that didn't include onions and peppers.  I decided to ask if they could make a burrito with just the carne asada, cheese and guacamole for him.  They said sure.  A man, came over to ask me what exactly I wanted, because he said cheese and guacamole didn't come in the "Classico."  I told him I didn't order the classico, that I have a picky 9 year old, and he just wants meat cheese and guacamole.  His burrito came with very little meat, lots of guacamole and no cheese.  Needless to say, he didn't like it very much.  I tried to scoop out some of the guac, so he could eat it.
I ordered their "Bonita Bowl," which sounded good.  I got carne asada, and it comes with beans, rice, sour cream, guacamole and they said they put it on lettuce.  We took the food to go, and when I got to my hotel, I was shocked when I opened it up, because more than half of it is was lettuce.  I didn't order a salad.  What was most disappointing was that there was very little meat.  I guess I am very spoiled living in San Diego, because when you order carne asada anything, the meat is the star of the show.  I could barely even taste any meat.
I'm guessing had I eaten there, things would have been better, and the rotisserie chicken did look good, but we had really wished we had gone to Pluto's instead.  We'lll stick to our carne asada in San Diego.
author: Susan M.

description: They messed up three of my orders and they weren't even busy. When I asked for a correction, they were completely rude and extremely slow to correct the issue. Ultimately, the food was too small for the price and had a very average, underwhelming taste. All of my food was cold. The restaurant has a nice interior, but what they have to offer is abysmal at best. Overpriced cold garbage.
author: Chris B.

description: Delicious AND affordable! Lost track of how many times i've been here :) highly recommend the Mexican Style rice.
author: stacey t.

description: My first visit to this neighborhood spot was a joy! I actually ordered a burrito bowl but got home to find rotisserie chicken, black beans, and mexican rice in my bag. It was outstanding! Can't wait to go back and try every thing on the menu! Great addition to the Marina.
author: Lucy R.

description: This place is absolutely delicious. The rotisserie chicken was very juicy and delicious. Everything we ordered was really flavorful and just how we ordered it. Can't wait to go back soon.
author: Kal N.

description: This is my one and only stop when I get a craving for some Mexican Food! With amazing food and amazing service, you will never go wrong making a stop here. The restaurant is clean and everything is made fresh daily. I recommend this place to anyone wanting a great meal in the city!
author: R N.
